loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience sells foodstuffs like yams, plantains, vegetables and fruits. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She has been in this business for long. 

She needs the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and fruits to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and fruits to sell

loans.name: Ezeem

texts.en:
OluwaF. lives in Lagos and she is a business woman. She buys and sells groceries like tomatoes paste, gallons of groundnut oil, wine and more. This serve as her means of livelihood. She has been in the business for over 15 years and she has been able to retain and attracts more customers to her shop. She wants to stock up her shop with more goods to sell in order to make more profit for the business and her family. She needs the loan of NGN100, 000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell.

OluwaF. is married with a 15 years old child and is doing well in school. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start up business

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is happy in his foodstuff business. He was selling electrical parts before he started his foodstuffs business. He hopes to expand his business in the future. Charles lives in Edo State, Nigeria. He is 39 years old and married to a teacher. They are blessed with 2 children. His children and doing well at school.

Charles needs the loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Najrabi Group

texts.en:
Torpikay is the group leader of Najrabi Group. She lives in 11th district of Kabul, Afghanistan, together with her husband and two of her children who are students.

Torpikay’s husband has a metal shop. He is a hardworking man and tries to provide a comfortable life and educated children. The loan Torpikay is requesting, will enable her husband to expand his business and buy some essential tools which can make his work easier. He hopes to soon grow his business and hopes to be a good businessman in the future.

loans.use: To enable her husband to expand his business and buy some essential tools

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is single and she is a tailor. She also sells sarongs to make a living. She has been in this business for long. She is 32 years old. She is a hard working lady. Evelyn lives in Edo state, Nigeria.

	She needs the loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Taibat

texts.en:
Taibat is into sells and supply of sarongs to her customers and she has been in the business for the past 30 years. She is 52 years of age and she has 4 children. She lives in Lagos with her children and she is a single mother who struggle to take care of her children in all aspect of life. 

She needs the loan of NGN50, 000 to purchase more sarongs to sell in order to meet her costumers demand. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support and she promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Madame Maïmouna Mané est mariée mère d'un enfant âgé d'un an. Elle est âgée de 32 ans et était jusqu'à 1997 en Asie avec son mari. Retournée au Sénégal pour les besoins médicaux traditionnels, elle s'en profite pour mener une activité commerciale qu'elle faisait il y'a longtemps avec l'aide de son mari. Elle vend des tissus, sacs, encens et compte des clients à travers les différents quartiers de Thiès. Avec ce montant demandé, elle pourra s'approvisionner en divers produits et développer son commerce.
texts.en:
Ms. Maïmouna Mané, age 32, is married and the mother of a one-year-old child. Maïmouna was in Asia with her husband until 1997. Having returned to Senegal for traditional medical treatment, she availed herself of a chance to run a business that she used to operate a long time ago with her husband's help. Maïmouna sells cloth, bags, and incense. And she has customers across the various districts of Thiès. With the asked-for sum, Maïmouna will be able to stock up on a variety of goods to develop her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies of various goods

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 42 years old and married with five children. She sells groceries, drinks and foodstuffs to make a living in Benin city, Edo state. She has been in this business since 4 years. With this business, she has been able to support her family. 

Justina needs the loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa make and sells snacks like buns, egg roll and pouf—pouf to costumers in wholesale and retail. She started this business 3 years ago and she is doing well in it. She sees this as a means of survival in Lagos. She likes the nature of her business because it gives her the opportunity to make more profit which she uses to take of her family needs. 

She is married with 5 children and she is 49 years old. She hopes for expansion in future, she asking for the loan amount of NGN50, 000 to purchase more flour in bags, yeast and sugar to make snacks and sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more flour, yeast and sugar to make snacks and sell.

loans.name: Tajeu Ole

texts.en: Tajeu Ole has made a living as a wheat farmer for the last 10 years.  He is 37 years old, married to Margaret Thoo and has three children, all of whom are  in school. He was introduced to KADET by a friend and is applying for his first loan. He plans to use the money to buy pesticides and pay his workers. Tajeu also plans to buy his own tractor, which will help him a great deal when harvesting and planting.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and pay his employees

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: B. Augustine is a creative businessman who is 52 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are still in school. Since 1997, he has made a living running a bakery, and sells his goods both wholesale and retail. He has applied for a loan to buy more equipment to bake cakes, make donuts and expand his business.  His long-term goal is to make his bakery as modern as possible, which he describes as operating efficiently and profitably, and able to make many kinds of cakes and breads.

loans.use: To buy more equipment to bake cakes, donuts and other items.

loans.name: Sonkoi Ole

texts.en: Sonkoi Ole is 24 years old and has made a living as a wheat farmer for the last six years. He entered this line of work because it is profitable and there are many customers. He was introduced to KADET by a friend and has applied for his first loan, which he will use to rent a tractor to plow his land for a new crop. Sonkoi also plans to start diversifying his output and begin growing snow peas for export, because demand for them is high.

loans.use: To rent a tractor to prepare his land for a new wheat crop.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 35 years old, married and has three children. She and her husband are both farmers. Janet learned about Kadet through a friend who is a member.  She is applying for her first loan, which she will use to buy seeds to grow corn and beans. She plans to produce a crop which is large enough for her to sell a portion of it in the local market, where she can earn a good profit. In the future, she plans to raise cows and increase her income enough to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy seeds to plant a crop of corn and beans

loans.name: Zacharia

texts.en: Zacharia has made a living as a wheat farmer for the last 10 years.  He is 32 years old, married to Esther Lemurt and has four children. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and is now applying for his first loan, which he will use to rent a tractor to prepare his land for a new crop. Zacharia hopes to have his own tractor in the future, and increase his income by renting it out.

loans.use: To rent a tractor to prepare his land for a new wheat crop.

loans.name: Joachim

texts.en: M. Joachim is a hard-working businessman of thirty-two years old, married with two children of whom one child is going to school. He owns a cosmetics shop selling both wholesale and also on a retail basis. He has spent over five years in his business. He is using the loan to purchase boxes of jelly, shampoo, relaxers, cold waves, radiant, and weaves like Ripo curls, braids such as pony tails among others. His business dream is to attract more and more customers to his shop so that there may be an increase in daily business sales and his personal dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase boxes of jelly, shampoo, relaxers, etc.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa A. comes from a farmer's family. He is 23 years old and works with his family in their farm, where they grow vegetables and fruits. His family also has an egg laying farm, where Issa gained experience in this field.

Issa was able to save a good amount of money and came to FATEN to take a $2000 loan. He is planning to start his own farm and start breeding egg-laying chickens. He will sell eggs to shops and restaurants in Tulkarem city and also hopes to expand his job to include a larger area around Tulkarem.

Issa hopes to renew the loan once the current one is repaid, in order to expand his business. Issa appears in the picture above in Tulkarem city

loans.use: Start egg-laying chicken farm

loans.name: Philisilah Ene

texts.en:
Philisilah has been a farmer since 1987.  She plants potatoes, cabbages, and wheat commercially.  She is 45 years old, married to Nkuruna T., and they have 4 children. She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the money to buy fertilizer for her potato crop and cultivate her land to plant wheat.

Philisilah plans to buy another plot of land in the future and advance her farming techniques using technology to increase her yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her potato crop and cultivate her land for wheat

loans.name: Topoika Ole

texts.en:
Topoika has been a wheat farmer for the last 10 years.  He is 38 years old, married to Sindi Ene K., and they have 4 children. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the cash to hire workers to help weed his farm and plant wheat.

Topoika hopes that he will be able to buy a tractor in the future, which he will use in his own farm and also hire out to increase his income.

loans.use: To hire worker to help him weed his farm and plant wheat

loans.name: Fatimoh

texts.en:
Fatimoh lives in Lagos with her family. She is married with 4 children and they are doing very well. She sells sarongs in her shop and also add the sales of shoes, bags and caps for more income. She has been in the business for some years. With it she earns her living and assists her husband in keeping the family. 

Fatimoh has the zeal to increase the size of her business and her profit margin in future. She hopes for the loan of NGN50, 000 to purchase more sarongs,shoes, bags, and caps to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes, bags, clothes and caps to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 56 years old and married with four children who are all adults. One of his children is currently attending school. He is a dairy farmer in Central Kenya in Murang'a town. He has been farming for the last 30 years with only one employee. His main produce is milk which he sells to the Kenya Cooperative Creameries. Joseph is also a cash crop farmer and earns income from the sale of tea at the local market. He is a veterinary doctor and earns income from the services he offers to the local people.

He recently completed his first loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.60,000 and has requested this second loan in the amount of KES.86,400 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from this loan will supplement his income from cash crop farming and according to him, this will improve his living standard. His biggest challenge with dairy farming is the fluctuation in milk prices and the high cost of dairy cows. Joseph would like to be in a position to produce 100 litres of milk per day, five years from now.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Henry K.

texts.en:
Henry is a thirty-year-old married gentleman with two children who are going to school.  He was introduced to Kadet by a friend whom he describes as someone whose life has been changed by Kadet loans. With this first loan he intends to buy fertilizer and maize seeds for planting. He also intends to buy an oxen to help with farm ploughing.

Apart from maize farming, Henry buys milk and sells at the nearby centre at a profit hence earning additional income. His future plan is to have his own dairy cows whose produce he will sell at the local centre and supply to big hotels in town. This will boost his income  and will enable his children to finish school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and maize seeds for planting

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en:
Philomina is 52 years old and a widow with 4 children. Life as a widow is very challenging. She sells drinks and cooked foods to be able to support her children by meeting their basic needs.

Philomena needs the loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She hopes to grow her business to become a world class restaurant in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 57 years old and married with five children, all except one of whom have completed school.

Jeremiah has been practicing mixed farming in Murang'a town in central Kenya. He has been in this business for thirty years and has three employees. His main products are milk, coffee and fruit which he sells to the local market. Jeremiah is also a businessman and earns some income from his agrovet (agricultural-veterinary) shop.

Jeremiah has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 63,600 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him to acquire a good dairy cow that will produce more milk and earn him more income. His biggest challenge is lack of a big enough market for his milk, and a poor road network that leads to delays in transportation of his perishable goods.

In future, Jeremiah intends to improve his dairy breed to pure-bred cattle that will increase his milk output. He says that “Through Juhudi Kilimo, the future is bright and income generation will be guaranteed.”

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Friends Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Grace A. calls herself a responsible and honest trader who buys maize at Mampong to sell at the Kumasi central market. She has been in this business for the past 15 years and hopes to secure silos at Mampong some day so she can buy maize at harvest time when prices are cheap and store it in the silos. According to her, she will supply maize to second cycle schools when the prices go up. Through this, Grace believes that she will be able to support her children's education to the university level.

Grace is the leader of 'Friends' trust bank group and she says they have known each other since childhood days hence the name 'Friends'. They are 10 in number and she was elected as group leader because she is a unifier. Members of the group are into the sale of maize, yams, beans and chop bar operation. All the group members plan to use the loan to grow their businesses so they can work towards achieving their dreams.

loans.use: Bags of maize

loans.name: Franklin Muguna

texts.en:
Franklin Muguna K. is 33 years old. He is married to Doris Nkatha and is the father of two children who are attending school.

Franklin has a pool-table business which he has been operating for the last six years on a busy street in Narok Town.

Franklin learned about KADET from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in the town. This will be his sixth loan. He is planning to buy another pool table and place it on another street in Narok because the business has proved to do well in the town.

With the profits Franklin hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to open another business and create employment for other people.

loans.use: To buy a new pool table for a second location

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is married to a timber contractor. They are blessed with 10 children. She sells groceries and roasted roasted beef. Having 15 years experience in this business has really helped her in getting more customers and more profit. 

Roseline hopes for a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Jediel

texts.en:
Seventy-three-year-old Jediel is married with seven children, one of whom is currently in college.

Jediel has been practicing mixed farming in Murang'a town in central Kenya for forty years and has one employee. His main product is milk which he sells to the local market. He also depends on his pension to cater for his needs and that of his family.

Jediel has requested this loan of KES 47,700 through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from this loan will enable him to pay college fees for his son.

In five years time, Jediel would like to increase the number of his dairy cows to four. He says that, "Juhudi is doing a great job, but should consider reducing the interest rate on its loans."

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ruzbibi

texts.ru: Одинаева Рузбиби проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 24 года. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж, работает строителем. Сама Рузбиби имеет среднее образование. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей. У нее магазин, где она продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Ruzbibi O. lives in the Vahdat region. She's twenty-four, and married with two children. Her husband is a builder. She has a secondary school education. She has been a vendor for more than five years, and has a store where she sells food products. Ruzbibi plans to use her loan to increase inventory.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian J. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and simsim (sesame seed) at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of simsim to sell. Lilian is 20 years old and is married to a policeman. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of simsim to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jaguru

texts.en:
Jaguru M. sells soft drinks and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of soda and mango juice to sell  She is 30 years old and married to a soldier. She has two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy crates of soda and mango juice to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 50 and married with four children, all of whom have completed school. She is a farmer in Central Kenya in Muranga town. She has been farming for 15 years with only one employee. Her main products are milk and maize which she sells to the local market. Cecilia depends on the income from her business to take care of her family's needs.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.53,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable her to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce more milk and increase her income. Her biggest challenges are unpredictable weather conditions, unstable milk prices, and animal diseases. In future she intends to acquire three pure-bred dairy cows.

She says that "Juhudi is setting a good example that community development can use to improve society's economic situation." She says that, through this project, she will be able to develop economically.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sanyu Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
Evidently, being good-humored and dignified are two requisite laurels and winning calling cards when it comes to doing business. Without these, as 42-year-old M. Margaret has found out, business will be stagnant and success will not be forthcoming.

For nine years this happy-go-lucky and easy-to-approach married mother of nine has banked on a dairy-sales business as her main means of livelihood. Her well-rounded experience mill in this business has helped her overcome most of the inevitable financial and operational problems that have come her way.

Margaret’s odds of success in her previous grocery store business were getting slimmer every year. After her husband prevailed upon her to go into the milk business, Margaret found it incumbent on her to give a good account of herself. In a month, her milk-sales business brings her profits amounting to 100,000 shillings and, with this first loan, she says she wants to buy bigger milk preservative containers to store all the milk supplies she gets from her suppliers.

loans.use: To purchase bigger milk preservative containers

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 42 years old and married with four children. Two of them are currently in school. Jane has been practicing dairy farming for the last 20 years in Central Kenya near Murang'a town. She sells her milk to the local market. She also earns some income from a retail shop she operates in the same area. 

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 52,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from this loan will enable her to educate her two children and cater for the family's needs. Her biggest challenge has been lack of enough money to purchase a good dairy cow and the unstable market prices for milk. She intends to improve on her dairy farming by acquiring four more dairy cows in future.

She says that "through Juhudi Kilimo there is hope that small scale farmers like herself will be able to develop."

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Moisari Ole

texts.en:
Moisari Ole L. is 30 years old. He is married to Nemuta L., and he is the father of two children who are currently in school.

Moisari is a farmer, and he has farmed his own piece of land for the last four years.
  
He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan. He is planning to plant more wheat, which has proved to do very well in this area. He also intends to keep some sheep to sell later. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer, both in wheat farming and sheep rearing.

loans.use: To plant four acres of wheat

loans.name: Achufa

texts.en:
Achufa J. is currently in the restaurant business and is requesting a loan to stock more beans and rice. Achufa is 20 years old and is married. Her husband is a clerk. She has one child who does not yet go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of beans and rice

loans.name: Domincah

texts.en:
63-year-old Domincah is a widow. She is a hardworking dairy farmer from Central Kenya in Murang'a town. She has been farming for the last 30 years with only one employee. Her main product is milk, which she sells to Kenya's Brookside company. She is also practicing small-scale cash crop farming and earns income from the sale of tea to the local market. 

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 31,800 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from this loan will reduce her dependency on cash crop farming which also has unstable market prices. She intends to improve on her dairy farming and is hoping that the market prices in the milk industry will stabilize.

She says that "there is hope for future development through Juhudi Kilimo micro-leasing projects."

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Magrete

texts.en:
Magrete is 48 years old and married with 8 children. She sells cooked foods and drinks- this is a business she has been doing since 10 years. With the business she has been able to make things easier for her family. She resides in Edo State with her family and they are living happily.

	Magrete needs the loan amount for NGN 40,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thank to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Letuyesi Ole Kamakei

texts.en:
Letuyesi Ole Kamakei K. is 40 years old. He is married to Jennifer K. and is the father of eight children.

Letuyesi is a farmer, and he has been doing this for the last twenty years. His farm is in a productive area. Most of his customers are wholesalers from the city who come to buy his potatoes and then sell them to city residents.

He learned about KADET through an awareness presentation done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan. He is planning to buy a new variety of potato called "sangi," which research has shown would do very well in his area and produce a higher yield. He also wishes to plant wheat on the remaining piece of land. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the demand for produce.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and have his own farm machinery.

loans.use: To plant a new variety of potato

loans.name: Lawa

texts.en:
Lawa A. is currently in the business of selling both fresh and dried fish at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more dried fish to sell.  Lawa is 42 years old and is married. Her husband is a small-scale farmer. She has five children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of dried fish

loans.name: Lucy Njoki

texts.en:
Lucy Njoki K. is 49 years old. She is married to Jackson K. and a mother of three children who are currently in school. Lucy is a farmer and she has been farming her own land for the last twenty years. She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered clients.

This will be her second loan of which she is planning to spend fifty thousand shillings to plant more maize which normally does well in her area due to good climatic conditions. She is planning to use the other thirty thousand shillings to buy a dairy cow. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activities from small-scale to commercial farming.

Lucy's dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. She is a hard-working woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to plant more maize and buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Abby

texts.en:
Abby cooks and sells cassava dough. This is one staple food in Nigeria mainly eaten in the Eastern, southern and western part of Nigeria. She has been in this business for long. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more cassava to cook more cassava dough to sell. 

Abby is 50 years old and she is married with 6 children. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 56 years old, married to James Njoroge, and they have four children who have finished school and are now married with their own families.

Jane has been a dairy farmer for ten years now.  She has been practicing on a small scale where she only sells the milk produced to her neighbors.  She joined KADET after being introduced by her friend and it's only through the training that she realized she can produce milk on a large scale and sell it to the local dairy companies which will increase her income.  She wants to start low and that’s why she has applied for this loan to buy another cow.

In future she plans to buy more cows by the help of KADET.  This will increase her milk production and her income.

loans.use: To buy another cow.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a carpenter and he has been in this business for a long time. He makes lovely chairs, tables and kitchen cabinets for his customers. He is 31 years old and married with a child. His wife also works to support their home. 

John needs the loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more materials like woods, foams and nails to boost his business. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to boost his carpentry business

loans.name: Dirisa

texts.en:
M. Dirisa is a hard-working business man of thirty, married with five children. He owns a retail shop located in Bulakati main market, Juma cell, Lukaya town council. His shop mainly deals with essential things like sugar, rice, maize flour, passion fruit and various others. He is using the loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, rice, millet flour, maize flour, passion fruit, etc. for resale so as to expand his business. 

His future hope is to expand his business, accumulate more profits, and use the accumulated profits to further improve his farming and give his children a better education and a better life.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar, rice, millet flour, maize flour, etc. for resale

loans.name: Daborah

texts.en:
Deborah sells plastics like bucket and bowl by hawking around her locality. She has been in the business for the past 20 years now.  She is a member in LAPO micro finance with good repayment record. She is married with 5 children and she is 48 years of age. Her husband work hard in order to provide for the family too. She lives with her family in Lagos. 
She hopes for the loan of NGN70, 000 to purchase more plastics to sell and make more profit. This she said will be reinvest into the business for more expansion and better care for the children. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 26 years old and has been practicing farming in Naivasha town for the last 4 years.  He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the cash to hire a tractor which he will use to cultivate his land for planting.

Benson hopes to one day buy his own tractor which will save him money and also generate income as he will be able to hire it out to other farmers in the area.

loans.use: To hire a tractor to help him cultivate his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter to cut fodder

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en:
Titilayo is married with 4 children and they are doing well in their respective school. She is 39 years of age and she lives with her husband who is a civil servant in Lagos. She sells groceries, foodstuffs and drinks. She works hard to make sure there is food on her children’s table. She opens her shop every day of the week in order to make more sales and profit. She started the business since 15 years ago and she like the nature of the business. 

She needs more capital to invest into the business, she is requesting for the loan amount of NGN50, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs, drinks and groceries to sell. She promise to pay promptly and says thanks to Kiva and LAPO for their wonderful initiatives.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs, drinks and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tekero Ole

texts.en:
Tekero Ole N. is 42 years old. He is married to Leah Nkowua and he is the father of seven children. Tekero is a farmer and he has been farming his own land for the last twenty years.
  
He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his third loan. He is planning to plant more potatoes which have proven to do very well in this area. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of potatoes and start wheat farming.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer both in potatoes and wheat farming.

loans.use: To plant potatoes on a bigger piece of land

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is married with 4 children. Her children are in primary and secondary school. She sells groceries, foodstuffs and drinks. She has been in this business since 4 years. Victoria has been able to support her family with part of the profit she gets from her business. She is requesting for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase a deep freezer and also rent a big stall for her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer and rent a bigger stall

loans.name: Panato Ole

texts.en:
Panato Ole S. is 37 years old. He is married to Naanyu S. and he is the father of two children who are going to school. Panato is a farmer and he has been farming his land for the last ten years.
  
He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his fourth loan. He is planning to spend twenty thousand in buying chemicals and fertilizers for wheat which he has already planted. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer in wheat farming.  He is a hard-working man and with the right resources he believes that he can do great.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizers for his wheat

loans.name: Nasieku Ene

texts.en:
Nasieku Ene T. is 54 years old. She is married to Jackson Kuntayo and is the mother of four children who are currently in school. Nasieku is a farmer and she has been farming for the past twenty years.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members with KADET. This will be her second loan which she is planning to use to prepare her land for maize planting. Maize has been doing well in her area due to good climatic conditions. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Nasieku's dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. Despite her age, Nasieku is a hard-working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To prepare the land for maize planting

loans.name: Peter Parkire

texts.en:
Peter Parkire K. is 24 years old. He is a single young man who is focused on farming. Peter has been farming for the last three years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan which he is planning to use to plant more wheat. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the demand for farm produce.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land.  Peter is a young and energetic man who believes he can succeed once he has necessary financial tools to help his business grow.

loans.use: To plant more wheat .

loans.name: Franca

texts.en:
Franca is a native of Edo State, Nigeria. She is into the business of tailoring and sales of sarongs and tailoring materials. She has been in this business for long. She has been able to care for her family with the proceeds from her business. She is married and blessed with a child. 
Franca needs the loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth N. is an ECD teacher and at the same time owns a hair salon business which she started in 2005 in Nambale town, Busia, Kenya to help generate enough income to support her family. She is 36 years old with five children.

Elizabeth travels as far as Bungoma once every two months to buy her stock. Like any other small-scale business person, Elizabeth has a dream to expand her business by venturing into dairy farming where she will be keeping dairy cattle and selling milk. This will ensure her financial security and she will be able to give her children a better education.

To do this, she needs a loan worth Ksh.20,000 to enable her to increase her stock.

loans.use: increase her stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kamakei Ole

texts.en:
Kamakei Ole K. is 23 years old. He is a single young man who is focused on farming. Kamakei has been farming for the past four years. 

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan with which he is planning to plant four acres of wheat which has proved to do well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the market demand for wheat.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land. Kamakei is a young and energetic man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To plant four acres of wheat

loans.name: Madrine

texts.en:
N. Madrine is a businesswoman of fifty years old, blessed with six children. She owns a retail cloth business and she is a tailor at the same time. She is located on old Masaka road in Kalisizo subcounty, Kyotera county, Rakai district. 

Her business mainly entails plain materials, blankets and fabric for making uniforms.  She is using the loan to purchase and stock plain materials, blankets and fabric for making uniforms and so forth. Her future aspirations are to maximize all the profits and make sure she constructs a house and educates her children.

loans.use: To purchase and stock plain materials, etc.

loans.name: Stephen Abuga

texts.en:
Stephen Abuga A. is 33 years old. He is married to Joyce Nyambura and the father of three children who are currently going to school. He is a carpenter and also runs a small kiosk business which he has been operating for the last ten years on a busy street in Narok Town.

He learned about KADET from the chairlady of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his second loan. He is planning to buy more stocks of sodas and food for his kiosk and also buy some equipment for his workshop.

With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to open a bigger workshop where he can focus on his carpentry work.

His future dream is that he will be able to build his own stand and his own house. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of sodas and food for the kiosk and buy carpentry tools

loans.name: Kapangua Ole

texts.en:
Kapangua Ole K. is 24 years old. He a single young farmer who has been farming for the last three years. 

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan with which he is planning to plant four acres of wheat which normally does well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a still bigger piece of land. Kapangua is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To plant four acres of wheat on his farm

loans.name: Ayub Kinyanjui

texts.en: Ayub, 30 years old, is married to Monica and the father of a five-year-old daughter. Introduced to Kadet through an existing KADET client, Ayub has been operating a funeral service business for the past six years. He plans to buy more coffins with the loan that he has applied for, and with the extra profit expected from the business, another Nissan Matatu for transport in his service. A hardworking and determined man who is always ready to help grieved families, he hopes to one day own his own mortuary.

loans.use: To buy more coffins and another vehicle for the business

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is indeed delighted with her business. She is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions and foodstuffs to boost her business. She has been in this business since 6 years. With these combined businesses, she hopes to support her husband in meeting the basic needs of their home. She needs the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell.

She is married to a welder and they are blessed with a child. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase hair extension to sell

loans.name: Joseph Kimani

texts.en:
Joseph is a 58-year-old farmer. He is married to Ann, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two adult sons and three adult daughters, all of whom are working. 

Joseph has been farming for the past 30 years. He was introduced to KADET through an existing KADET client. He plans to buy a better dairy cow and dairy feed with the loan he has applied for.  

Joseph intends to buy more dairy cows in the future with his expected profits. His hopes and dreams are to get more money and improve the living standards of his family. He describes himself as a middle-class, mixed agricultural farmer who is hardworking and loves his family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and dairy feed

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has a pharmacy store where she sells drugs, groceries, wine and baby items in order to sustain her self and family financially. She does this trade in Lagos and has been it for some years now. She lives in Lagos with her husband who is a civil servant. She is very determines to pull her family out of poverty by increasing her business and profitability. 
She is 40 years of age and she hopes for the loan of NGN100, 000 to purchase more drugs, groceries, wine and baby items to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs, groceries, wine and baby items to sell.

loans.name: Christine Wanjiru

texts.en:
Christine is a 69-year-old farmer. She is a single mother of three sons and one daughter. 

She was introduced to KADET through an existing KADET client. She has been farming for the past five years. Christine plans to buy a chaff cutter and animal feeds with the loan. She sells her farm produce to hotel businesses and other small-scale farmers. She intends to expand her business and open a retail shop for selling animal feeds with the extra profit expected from her farming business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to be an international distributor of her products and to educate her children to the university level. She describes herself as a hardworking lady, a born-again Christian and an honest and development-oriented farmer.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter and animal feeds

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 50 years old and married with six children who are all adults. She is a farmer from Central Kenya in Murang'a town. She has been farming for over 20 years and has over time employed workers on a temporary basis. Her only source of income is the cereals and milk from her farm that she sells to the local market. Her major challenge in the farming business has been lack of enough income to improve on the number of dairy units.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 31,800 Kenyan shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will enable her to acquire a good dairy cow that will earn her enough income and help her support her children in college. In the future, she is hoping to have more than five dairy cows, hence improving her living standard.

She says that Juhudi is really helping small-scale farmers not only by financing them, but also by training them on how to do business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Esther Waruguru

texts.en: Esther is a 33 year old woman who operates a hostel business. She is married to Peter, a businessman. She was introduced to KADET through KADET marketing outreach in her home town of Thika. She has been operating her hostel businesses for the past six years. Esther plans to increase the number of rooms and to add facilities (e.g beds, beddings, etc.) with the loan she has applied for. She intends to add more rooms for her hostel business with the extra profit expected from her business. Her hopes and dreams are to have her own building for a hostel business one day. Esther describes herself as a hardworking person.

loans.use: To increase amount of hostel rooms and to add facilities.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old. She is married and has eight children aged 8 years to 30 years old. Three of the children are currently in school. Mary is a farmer from Western Kenya, in Kitale town, where she has been practicing mixed farming for 10 years. Her main products are milk and maize, which she sells to the local market. She also rears sheep which she sells to the local market. Her biggest challenge in this business was when her cow died due to a calving problem. This was a big loss to her dairy farm.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 31,200 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the milk from the dairy cow will her family with milk for their own consumption. The rest of the milk will be sold to earn income that will enable her educate her children. In future she expects the dairy cow will have 4 or 5 other good breeds which will enhance her farming.

She says she has taken the right path to join a Juhudi Kilimo group which assisted her to obtain a dairy cow. She promises to repay the loan accordingly and obtain another loan.

loans.use: To purchase and insure  a dairy cow.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “La Amistad” se reúnen cada treinta días en las oficinas de la unidad de micro finanzas de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el ciclo 6 y está conformado por 14  personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 
 
Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a lo que se dedican son a las ventas de desayuno a base de quinua, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida, venta de caldos, venta de comestibles y otros socios brindan servicios como por ejemplo  de transportes,  agencia de transportes, taxistas y además son profesionales como abogados y docentes.

Giovanna, tiene 38 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos y su principal actividad económica es vender comida, ella prepara almuerzo y cena de lunes a sábados y trabaja desde las 7 mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Ya son 2 a 3 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo, ella requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar insumos  como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, azúcar, aceite y verduras. 

Giovanna forma parte del  banco comunal desde hace 2 años y se considera una persona responsable y puntual con el pago de las cuotas. 

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora de la región sur del país.
texts.en:
The members of the "La Amistad" (Friendship) Village Bank meet every thirty days at the offices of the Cusco City Asociación Arariwa microfinance department. The village bank is currently in its sixth loan cycle and consists of fourteen members, hardworking and enterprising people who are always on the lookout for opportunities to succeed, and make a daily effort to bring a better future to their children. Members' businesses include selling quinoa-based breakfast foods, as well as meals, soups, other food products, and cosmetics. Other members provide services, including transportation and taxi services, and still others are professionals like lawyers and teachers. Giovanna is thirty-eight-years-old, married, and has three children. Her primary business is selling meals. She prepares lunch and dinner and is on the job Monday through Friday, from 7:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night. She's been in business now for two or three years and things are going very well thanks to the determination she brings to the job. She needs a loan to increase her working capital and she would like to buy ingredients including rice, noodles, sugar, oil, and vegetables. Giovanna has belonged to the village bank for two years and considers herself to be a responsible and punctual person with respect to her payments. The members value and appreciate the loans they receive through this means, and they are committed to making their payments on time. Cusco is a lovely city in the southern region of the country, known for its archaeological sites, historical center, landscape, and history.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, noodles, sugar, oils, and vegetables.

loans.name: Onyinyechi

texts.en:
Onyinyechi own a shop where she sells foodstuffs like garri, beans, rice, melon, stock fish and more. She has been in the business for over 7 years. 
She is married with 2 children and she is 27 years old. Her husband is business man and they lives in Lagos. With the proceeds from the business, she could support her husband in taking care of the children needs like clothing, feeding, and more. 

Onyinyechi wants to stock up her shop with more foodstuffs and she needs the loan of NGN50, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell to her numerous costumers as this will increase her sales and boost her profit. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en: Abiodun is a LAPO client with good  repayment records. She is 35 years old, married with 5 children. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy as a mother. She sells female clothes to make a living. Yusuf is very determined and wants to expand the size of her business in order to make more profits. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more female clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more female clothes to sell

loans.name: Maurice  Kurgat

texts.en:
Maurice K. is 36 years old and married to Nelly Kurgat. They have five children: Faith (14 years old, in primary school), Titus (12 years, in primary), Sofia (7years old, in primary), Jemutai (3 years old) and Douglas (2 months old). 

Maurice practices horticultural farming. He started this business 5 years ago. From this venture he gets a monthly profit of KES 10,000, which is his only source of income. Maurice has borrowed a loan of KES 80,000 from KADET. He will purchase seeds, fertilizer,  insecticides, as well as use some money for ploughing and transplanting. 

Maurice was introduced to KADET by a leader of the local government in a public baraza (community meeting). Maurice does business in a semi arid area. If this loan boosts his business, Maurice will use the extra profit to expand his business.

Maurice dreams and hopes to have a plot of land and also to expand his business. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Stand On Your Feet Group

texts.en:
Yassa Y. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Stand On Your Feet. She is 43 years old, married, and has six children who range from 6 to 26 years old. She did not have the opportunity to attend school due to poverty.

For 8 years she has been selling dried meat, red oil, and rice in Smell-No-Taste Market, Harbel, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning.
  
She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 46,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more rice, dried meat and red oil. Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Yassa is the one holding the sign. Inset at the lower right is Annie T..

loans.use: To buy more rice, dried meat and red oil.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Celestina is a LAPO client with good repayment records. She is 42 years old, married with 5 children. She sells used clothes to make a living. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. Celestina is very determined and wants to expand the size of her business in order to make more profits. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more used clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Batuli Salim

texts.en:
Batuli is a 65 year old widowed mother of seven grown up children. She sells charcoal in Kisumu Ndogo, an area within Malindi. Batuli also has built rental houses on her plot to boost her income. She has been in this business for three years and gets KES 6000 profit, monthly.

This loan will enable her to buy more stock of charcoal with KES 15,000 and to repair her rental houses with KES 5000. Batuli had borrowed before with another MFI that, unfortunately, disappeared with clients' savings. She was introduced to KADET by an existing client. She plans to improve the roofing of her house and that of the rental houses with the extra income that she expects to get from this loan. She hopes to build more rental houses and to improve them by providing water and electricity for her tenants.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and to repair rental homes.

loans.name: Cristo La Solucion 4,5 Group

texts.en:
Regina is the coordinator of her group Cristo L. Solucion 4,5 (Christ is the Solution), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding L. Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with with her long term partner and two children.

Regina is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a "fantasia" (fantasy), a variety store catered to women, by purchasing sandals, blouses and perfumes. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. She feels at that, at this stage, growing her business to be sustainable is more important than using the profits on other purchases. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase sandals, blouses and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Pius Kiproech

texts.en:
Pius Kiproech R. is a 37 year old man married to Nancy Koech. They  have 5 children: Titus (15 years old, in primary school), Kiplagat (13 years old , in primary school), Kimutai (12 years old, in primary school) Sharon (9 years old, in primary school) and Jepkemei (4 years old, in primary).

Pius practices horticultural farming. He started this venture four years ago. From this business he gets a profit of KES 15,000.
He has borrowed a loan of KES 75,000 from KADET. Pius will use the loan for fencing, clearing the land, acquiring skilled labor, purchasing seeds, and purchasing fungicides and insecticides.

Pius practices horticultural farming in a semi arid area. If this loan boosts his business, he will use the extra profit to extend his horticultural practices. Pius's hopes and dreams are to own a transport vehicle. He describes himself as a hardworking Christian farmer.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and for fencing.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a LAPO client with good repayment records. She is 40 years old, married with 3 children. She sells used clothes to make a living. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. Gloria is very determined and wants to expand the size of her business in order to make more profits. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more used clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Morris Karithi

texts.en:
Morris is a 28-year-old hardworking man, married, with one child named Albert. He has a retail shop in Malindi's old market, where his business is strategically located in the market. He's been in business for 12 years now and earns a profit of KES 30000 a month. 

He was introduced to Kadet by the chairman of his group and has not borrowed from another MFI before. He will use his loan to expand his business premises and to add stock. 

The extra earnings from this loan will be channeled to completing the rental houses that he is already building. He hopes to own an electronic shop in Malindi and to expand his retail business.

loans.use: To expand business premises and to add more stock.

loans.name: Jayanthi

texts.en:
Jayanthi is a 27-year-old married woman who lives in Kekanadura, part of the Matara area of Sri Lanka. She has two children, a son and a daughter who are both still in school.

Five months ago, Jayanthi started a business making coconut oil. She buys coconuts from wholesalers, dries them, brings them to a mill and then prepares the coconut oil. She earns respectable profits from this business.

Jayanthi has asked for a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri lanka to purchase coconuts for her business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy coconuts

loans.name: Samuel Muiru

texts.en:
Samuel Muiru is 30 years old and is married to Irine Wamboi, a 21 year old business lady. They live in Kabarnet Town and have three children: Michael (6 years, Top Class), Mary (3 yrs: Baby Class), and Jane (9 months old).

Samuel runs a boutique, which he started eight years ago. Residents of Kabarnet Town are his clients. He gets a monthly profit of KES 50,000 from the boutique. He was introduced to KADET by one of KADET's clients. He has never borrowed from another source before. 

Samuel has borrowed a loan of KES 40,000 from KADET. He will USE KES 30,000 to purchase new clothes, KES 5,000 to purchase bags and KES 5,000 for shoes. All these items are for resale.

If this loan boosts his business, Samuel will use the extra profit to open a M-PESA mobile money transfer business. His hopes and dreams is to open a M-PESA shop.

loans.use: To purchase stock.

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en:
48 years old Bosede lives in Lagos and she is into the sales of drinks, juice and table water. She has been managing the business for over 15 years. She likes doing the business because it gives her opportunity of meeting with other people from a different background and having time with her children as well. 

Bosede is married with 3 children and her husband is a journalist and they both lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. 
In future, she wants to buy her goods directly from the companies so she can sell in wholesale and retail to her customers. She hopes for the loan of NGN80, 000 to purchase more drinks, juice and table water to sell. She is grateful to all lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, juice and table water to sell.

loans.name: Lilian Baraza

texts.en:
Lilian is a 34 year old mother of three children, aged between 2 years to 13 years of age. She is married to Haro, a teacher by profession. 

Lilian is in the business of transport, where she owns a motorcycle and employs someone else to operate it. Lilian is also employed in a hotel in Malindi. She has been in business for the last twelve years and earns a profit of KES 10,200 a month.

She hopes to venture into the clothes business and thus will spend KES 40,000 to source new materials for sale. She will use KES 10,000 for repairing the motorcycle and she can save KES 10,000.

She was introduced to KADET by an existing member in her group and this is her second loan, after successfully completing her first loan. Lilian also desires to have a cereals shop and will use the extra earnings from this loan towards this venture. She wants to be able to educate her children comfortably and to build rental houses on her plot of land.

loans.use: Source for materials(clothes), repair motorcycle and save

loans.name: Philo

texts.en: Philo sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business since 4 years. She is a LAPO client and she has a good repayment record. She is 45 years old, married with 6 children. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy as a mother. Her husband is a police man and he also supports their home. Philo is very determined and wants to expand her business in order to make more profits. She requesting for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Philo says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Las Tigresas Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “Las Tigresas” se reúnen cada treinta días en las oficinas D. la unidad D. micro finanzas D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el ciclo 10 y está conformado por  13  personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 
 
Las actividades económicas D. algunos D. los socios a lo que se dedican son a las ventas D. emoliente, venta D. chompas, venta D. cosméticos, venta D. artesanía, venta D. comida, venta D. jugos y otros socios brindan servicios D. pintado D. carros  y además son profesionales en enfermería.

Violeta, tiene 29 años y tiene una hija. Su principal actividad económica es vender artesanía  y su puesto D. trabajo está en la calle Inca roca y esta cerca a la piedra D. los 12 ángulos en la plaza D. armas D. la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 6 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo,  Su sueño D. Violeta es ampliar su negocio y tener una propia tienda.    

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora D. la región sur del país.
texts.en:
Members of “Las Tigresas” (Tigresses) communal bank meet every thirty days in Asociación Arariwa’s Micro Finances Unit offices in Cusco. The bank is currently in its 10th cycle and it’s composed of 13 hard-working enterprising members who seek opportunities to succeed at all times hoping through their daily efforts to proviD. a better future for their children. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities. Some sell soothing creams, sweaters, cosmetics, handicrafts, food and juices while others proviD. auto painting and nursing services. Violeta, 29, has a daughter. Her main commercial activity is selling handicrafts. Her stand is on Inca Roca street near the Twelve-Angle Stone in Cusco’s main square. She has been in this line of work for 6 years and does well thanks to the efforts she puts into her work. Violeta’s dream is to enlarge her business and to own her own store. The members value and appreciate the loan granted through this means and pledge to repay in a timely fashion. Cusco is a city known for its archaeological sites, its historic city center, its scenery and its history; it’s an enchanting city in the south of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweaters, ceramics, bags and plants.

loans.name: Chidima

texts.en: Chidima sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business since 5 years. She is a LAPO client and she has a good repayment record. She is 40 years old, married with 6 children. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy as a mother. Her husband also works to support their home. She is very determined and wants to expand her business in order to make more profits. She requesting for a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Yemi

texts.en:
Yemi is married with 3 children and she is 46 years of age. Her husband is a Police officer and they lives in Lagos. She sells cooked food, sachet water, drinks and groceries in her shop in order to make earns meet. She has been in the business for the past 5 years. 

She hopes to rent a bigger shop in future where she can attend to more costumers. She is requesting for the loan amount of NGN80, 000 to purchase a deep freezer which can be use to cool drinks and sachet water for her customers thereby attracting more costumers and improve her profit margin. She appreciates all lenders for great support.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer to cool her drinks to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 50 years old, married with 6 children. She is a tailor and she also sells tailoring materials to boost her business. Victoria is very determined and wants to expand her business in order to make more profits and also support her husband. She is requesting for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. Victoria thanks all Kiva lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Humphrey

texts.en:
Humphrey A. is young energetic man with a passion for business. At the age of 20 years, Humphrey is in the cereal business, which he started in 2008 after finishing his secondary education. He wants to take this loan so that he can be able to raise enough money to see him continue with his education.

He would like to expand his business by increasing his stock and wishes for a loan worth KES 5000 to help him do this. Being single with no children to take care of, Humphrey wants to see his living standard improve before he goes into marriage.

loans.use: To increase stock to boost his business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Everlyne Namukove

texts.en:
Everlyne Namukove N. is a 46 year old married woman with two (2) children. After quitting her former job as a civil servant in 2001, she started a clothes selling business in Nambale Busia Kenya so as to generate income and also to be self-employed.

She travels to Nairobi on a weekly basis to buy her stock. Despite the current economic times, Everlyne would like to increase her stock and expand her business and she would wish to get a loan worth KES 30,000 to achieve this.

Her dream is to be financially stable so that she can be able to support the disadvantaged in society.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a LAPO client. She is 45 years old, married with 7 children. Her children are doing well at school. Her husband works as a security guard to support their home. She cooks and sells cassava dough popularly known as Santana or akpu. She has been in this business for long. Florence is very determined and wants to expand the size of her business in order to make more profits to support her home. She is requesting for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more cassava to cook more cassava dough to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to cook more cassava dough to sell

loans.name: Milka Jepchumba

texts.en:
Milka is a 49 year old woman, married to Moses Kelwon, a 55 year old farmer. They live in Kaprogonya and have six children: Victor (28 yrs), Philemon (14 yrs), Caleb (12 yrs), Esther (8 yrs), Deborah (6 yrs) and Hilda (5 yrs).

Milka sells clothes. She started this business a year ago and it yields a profit of KES 2000 every month. Her salary brings in an income of KES 14,000. She has borrowed a loan of KES 15,000 form KADET. She plans to use this loan to add more stock. A client of KADET introduced her to KADET.
Milka does her business in Kabarnet Town. Her clients are mostly women and children. If her loan boosts her business she will plough back the extra profit to expand her business. As someone who loves her business, Milka dreams and hopes to get more capital to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for the business.

loans.name: Review Justus Tuva

texts.en:
41 year old Justus is a farmer in Malindi. He farms maize, onions and kale and has been in this business for 13 years. He also does some fishing on the side. A father of eight young children, whose ages are between 10 months and 6 years. Justus earns a profit of KES 6500 a month and targets residents of Malindi for his sales. 

Justus learned about KADET when he attended an agricultural forum and got more information from the KADET office. He is now in his second loan cycle. He will utilize KES 7500 on land preparation, KES 5000 on seedlings, KES 9000 for fertilizer and pay for labourers with KES 8000.The extra profit from this loan will enable Justus to expand his farming activities and to employ more workers. A hardworking man, Justus hopes to invest in the education of his children and to build a better residential house for his family.

loans.use: Land preparation, to buy hybrid seeds, fertilizer and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Jackline Olima

texts.en:
Jackline Olima N. sells electronics, a business she started in 2009 due to demand. Drop in demand made her quit her former business of selling plastics. Despite being married, Jackline plays a very pivotal role in supporting the family. She is currently 40 years old, married, and has two (2) children. This family is living in Nambale Busia Kenya. Jackline travels as far as Nairobi once a month to buy her stock.

Jackline would like to expand her business so as to improve her living standard. She would wish to get a loan worth KES 20,000.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ali Suleiman

texts.en:
51-year-old A. is the father of five children. He sells charcoal to Malindi Town residents and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 12000 a month. A. sells water, too. 

He was introduced to KADET by the chairlady of his group. This is his second loan after successfully completing his first loan. He has no prior credit history apart from KADET. He will stock charcoal with Kshs 45000 and pay for transport with Kshs 5000. With the proceeds from this loan, he will open a store for his charcoal and firewood business.

A. hopes to buy a truck to help him with transportation for his business.

loans.use: Buy charcoal and pay for transportation

loans.name: Mohammed Ahmed

texts.en:
50-year-old Mohammed is a carpenter. He and his wife have six children, two of whom are grown. He has been in the carpentry business for 25 years and sells to the locals of Malindi, especially for weddings and tourism. He earns a monthly profit of Kshs 16500. 

This loan will enable him to finish a project he had already started by buying hardwood, paying salaries, and paying for miscelleneous expenses related to the project. He was introduced to KADET by an existing member of his group. With profits from this loan, he plans to buy a woodcutting machine. He also hopes to acquire a yard to sell timber and charcoal.

loans.use: Buy hardwood and pay salaries for a carpentry project

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a LAPO client. She is 51 years old, married with 8 children. Her children are doing well at school. Her husband works as a security guard to support their home. She is a hard working woman. She cooks and sells cassava dough popularly known as Santana or akpu. She has been in this business for long. She is very determined and wants to expand the size of her business in order to make more profits to support her home. She is requesting for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more cassava to cook more cassava dough to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to cook more cassava dough to sell

loans.name: Phanice Anyolo

texts.en:
Phanice Anyolo P. lives in Nambale Busia, Kenya with her family. She is 41 years old and married with six (6) children. She sells clothes; a business she started in 2006 after quitting a fish business. She buys her stock in Nambale once every two weeks.

Her dream is to educate her children; something she believes will be possible but only with increased income. To do this, she first needs to expand her business by increasing her stock. She wishes to get a loan worth Ksh.10,000

loans.use: Increase stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a machine for her business

loans.name: Jane Warigia

texts.en:
Jane Warigia is a 29-year-old married business lady.  She has a shop where she sells cooking fat, cooking flour, and body lotions to her clients in Shauro Moyo, Nairobi. She has been in the business for a period of eight years now, with a monthly profit of 42,000 Kenya shillings.

She was introduced to KADET by an existing client. She wants to use her loan to buy more stock of cooking fat, cooking flour, and body lotions. 

Jane is ambitious and hard-working and wants to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add stock of cooking flour, cooking fat and body lotions

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is 40 years old, married with 4 children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home. She sells steamed beans cake popularly called moi-moi in Nigeria. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She has been in this business since 5years. She hopes to expand her business in order to make more profits. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more beans to cook more steamed beans cakes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beans

loans.name: El Futuro 1,2,3,4 Group

texts.en:
Yahaira is the coordinator of her group El Futuro (The Future), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the areas surrounding La Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their three children.

Yahaira is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, running a beauty salon, by purchasing the necessary shampoos, conditioners, dyes and straighteners. She will use the profits to invest in the education of her children by purchasing school supplies. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase conditioner, shampoo, straightener, and hair dye

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. ALEJANDRINA, ella tiene 57 años de edad, es separada y tiene 3 menores hijos, Nuestra socia alterna su trabajo con el comercio minorista, la socia cría animales menores para la venta, la socia tiene cuyes, aves de corral, chanchos, ovejitas; Nuestra socia también tiene terrenos de cultivo  en los cuales siembra maíz, habas, papa. Ella tiene un par de ganados vacunos y está pensando en comprar un ternerito. La socia desea el préstamo para aumentar a un dinero que ella tiene ahorrado y comprar un ternerito.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Alejandrina, lives in Anta district, Anta province, Cusco department; she’s a member of “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN” communal bank.
