Alejandrina, 57, is separated and has three minor children. She is both a retailer and she raises small farm animals to sell; she has guinea-pigs, barnyard fowl, pigs and sheep. She also has farmlands where she grows corn, broad beans and potatoes. She owns a pair of head of cattle and is thinking about buying a calf. She needs funds to add to her savings to buy a calf. She is grateful for and values the loan granted through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 43 years old, married with 6 children. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy as a mother. She is a happy and hard working woman. She sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to make a living. She has been in this business since 6 years and she hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi is 46 years old, married with 6 children. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy as a mother. Her husband also works to support their home. She is a happy and hard working woman. She sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to make a living. She has been in this business since 5 years and she hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy gold to make jewelry

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. JUANA,  ella tiene  51 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3  hijos, Nuestra socia alterna su labor de ama del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas desde 20 años, nuestra socia ahora también está en el negocio de compra y venta de ropas. La socia solicita el préstamo para traer mercadería y vender a sus amigas y a sus allegados.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Juana, lives in Anta district, Anta province, Cusco department; she’s a member of “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN” communal bank. Juana is 51 years old, married and has three children. She alternates her household chores with retail activities: she has sold prepared meals for over 20 years. She is also a clothing merchant. She needs funds to bring merchandise to sell to her friends and acquaintances. She is grateful for and values the support provided through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 40 years old, married with 4 children. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy as a mother. Her husband also works to support their home. She is a happy and hard working woman. She sells medicines and cosmetics at retail prices to make a living. She has been in this business since 10 years and she hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more medicines and cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase medicines and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials for her business

loans.name: La Familia Renacer 3,4 Group

texts.en:
Sergida is the coordinator of her group, L. Familia Renacer (The Family Reborn), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding S., a large city known for tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Sergida is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling a variety of items including mostly products for salons, but also pants and shirts. She will use the profits to invest in new doors and windows and for her home as well as school supplies for her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy products for salons plus pants and shirts to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 50 years old, married with 5 children. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy as a mother. Her husband also works to support their home. She is a happy and hard working woman. She sells sarongs, drinks and groceries at retail prices to make a living. She has been in this business since 2005 and she hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sarongs and groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Qolquewasi Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “Qolquewasi” se reúnen cada treinta días en las oficinas de la unidad de micro finanzas de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el ciclo 12 y está conformado por  personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 
	
Gladys, tiene 47 años, es viuda,  tiene tres hijas de las cuales dos son independientes y una todavía depende de  ella. 

Gladys nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Qolquewasi”  somos  13 integrantes (10 mujeres y 3 varones) y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Gladys es enfermera y trabaja en ESSALUD. Ya son 20 años que trabaja en el seguro y le va muy bien. Ella y su hermana Nataly tienen un negocio familiar de venta de artesanía en el centro comercial “Intipakaria”  en la Av. del Sol de la ciudad del Cusco. Gladys hace dos años que fue elegida como la fiscal.  Gladys requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo tela, pinturas, etc.     

Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a lo que se dedican son  a las ventas de  comestibles, venta de productos secos, venta de cuyes, venta de autopartes, venta de panadería, venta de muebles  de madera y otros socios brindan servicios de transportes, empleada, atención de familia, profesora de inicial, lavar ropa y además son profesionales en ingeniería de sistemas y educación.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora de la región sur del país.

(La socia Lucila a parece en la parte inferior de fotografía pues llegó tarde a la toma de la foto).
texts.en:
The members of the “Qolquewasi” communal bank meet every thirty days in the offices of the “Asociación Arariwa” microfinance company in the city of Cusco. Currently, the communal bank is in its 12th cycle and is made up for hardworking, enterprising people who are always looking for ways to get ahead. With their daily efforts, they are securing a better future for their children. Gladys is a 47 year old widow with three children, two of whom are grown up and one who is still dependent upon her. Gladys tells us: “In my communal bank “Qolquewasi” there are 13 members (10 women and 3 men) and they elected me to represent the communal bank and give my testimony of my economic activity.” Gladys is a nurse and works in ESSALUD. It has been 20 years since she started working there and it is going very well. Along with her sister Nataly, she has a family business selling crafts in the “Intipakaria” market on the Sol Avenue in the city of Cusco. Gladys requires the loan in order to buy things such as material and paints for work. The economic activities of some of the members include selling groceries, dry goods, guinea pigs, car parts, bread, and wooden furniture. Some members are involved in the service industry working in transportation, housekeeping, child minding, teaching and laundry services. Others are professionals in engineering systems and education. The members value and appreciate the loans authorized through this method and promise to repay the loan in the established plan. Cusco is a city that is known for its archeological and historical centers, its scenery, and its history. Cusco is a much loved city in this southern region of the country. (Lucila, one of the group members, appears in a separate photo since she arrived late to the photo session).

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gladys requires the loan in order to buy things for work such as material, paints etc.

loans.name: Yesu Amala Group, Kampala

texts.en:
She is a graceful 38-year-old woman with four children, but being divorced led her into a reality check. N. Topy had to quickly come to terms with the fact that she had to take care of her four children and two orphans without the assistance of a man.

Thirteen years ago Topy began with a charcoal-selling business in Kamwokya. She knew the only way she could quickly establish herself a niche in such a fledgling competitive business was through good interactions with her clients and to increase her charcoal stock.

After she built on her knowledge of the business, Topy quickly started getting a reputation for herself. Her clientele grew as a result of her hard work and up to now her business is still gaining ground.

Many factors have played into Topy’s favor, outstanding of which is her affable customer care skills. In a month, Topy says she makes profits to the tune of 300,000 shillings and she is anticipating even more once she gets this loan.

Topy’s future plans are based around the expansion of her business through buying more bags of charcoal and also trying her hand at selling fish.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal and fish to sell

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él Sr. Miguel,  el socio tiene 42 años de edad, es separado y tiene 2 hijos, Nuestro socio trabaja vendiendo golosinas en su casa, el socio puso una tienda pequeña para vender juegos de entretenimiento y golosinas a los transeúntes y en especial a los niños que pasan por su tienda cada día. Nuestro socio también se dedica  a la compra y venta de animales menores, el socio vive en la plaza principal de Anta y aprovecha muy bien su ubicación para sus negocios.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the VIRGEN IMMACULADA CONCEPCION community bank and lives in Anta in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. He is Sr. Miguel, 42 years old, separated, with 2 children. He makes a living selling sweets from his house. He set up a small store selling toys and sweets to passers-by and his best customers are neighborhood children. He also buys and sells animals. Miguel lives on the main plaza of Anta, an ideal location for doing business. Miguel is grateful for the support that this measure provides and he is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy goods for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods for her grocery shop

loans.name: Bruno Emilio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él Sr. BRUNO,  el socio tiene 55 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, Nuestro socio alterna sus actividades con la docencia, Nuestro socio es profesor de primaria, el socio trabaja en la comunidad  Chacán,  en Anta, él socio también trabaja sus terrenos de cultivo sembrando papa. Maíz, trigo, cebada, hortalizas, entre otros productos; El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, abono y así continuar con su segunda actividad.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION community bank and lives in Anta in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. He is Sr. Bruno, 55 yeaars old and married with 2 children. He alternates between his work as an elementary school teacher in the town of Chacan and work on a farm that he owns where he grows potatoes. His other crops include maize, wheat, barley, vegetables, etc. Bruno is applying for a loan so that he can buy seeds, manure and other supplies for his farming business. Bruno is grateful for the support that this measure provides and is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Don Pedro es padre de familia de tres hijos, estudiantes, tiene 61 años de edad, comerciante su negocio es la venta de granos básicos como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, maíz, pollo, apoyándolo su esposa con las ventas. Inicio con dinero de ahorro y su liquidación de su trabajo anterior. Cuando lo hizo comenzó con una pulpería, pero luego giro el negocio mas a la venta de granos básicos en cantidad, como la venta de pollo, es por eso necesita comprar otro freezer para poder cubrir la demanda de la venta de pollo, a si como la compra de una vitrina para lucir sus productos. Con esto espera aumentar las ventas, e invertir en más productos de consumo diario. El beneficio de estos financiamientos es que ha logrado aumentar las ventas como equilibrar su negocio.
texts.en:
Don Pedro is the head of a family of three children, all in school. He is 61 years old and operates a business selling basic staples: beans, rice, sugar, maize, chicken. His wife helps him with sales. He started the business with savings and a redundancy payment that he received from a former employer. He started with a small grocery, but then switched to selling larger volumes of basic staples. Chicken, for example, and it's for chicken sales that he needs a loan because he wants to buy another freezer to store enough chickens to meet demand. He also wants to buy a display case for his products. He hopes to increase his sales and invest in more supplies of basic staples. The advantage of these loans is that he has been able to use them to rebalance the business as well as increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer to increase chicken sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Build an infrastructure for a machine to wash potatoes

loans.name: Cherono

texts.en:
31-year-old Cherono is a single mother of three children between 7 and 11 years old. All of the children attend school. Cherono has been farming for the last five years. She depends mainly on the income from the sale of vegetables, milk and fruits to provide for her family. She is from Western Kenya in Kitale town.

Cherono is one of the many active clients of Juhudi Kilimo who have accessed several loans to expand their farming business. She has successfully completed her fifth loan of KES. 32,000. She has requested this sixth loan from Juhudi for KES. 32,000 to expand her poultry project and buy a dairy goat. This loan will enable her to purchase more layers (chickens kept for eggs), which will increase her sales and earn her more income. This income, she says, will help her improve her family's standard of living.

Cherono is happy because from the previous loans she has been able to generate income that has enabled her to acquire her own piece of land. She plans to have two dairy cows and be the main milk supplier of the local market.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project and purchase a dairy goat

loans.name: Llamocctachi Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Llamocctachi  inicia su ciclo 23 con 21 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. verduras, abarrotes en general, animales menores, golosinas, agricultura D. verduras y crianza D. animales.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Violeta es la secretaria del Banco Comunal, Violeta es casada, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Violeta tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Violeta se dedica a la crianza D. cuyes, tiene galpones en su casa, y ella misma se encarga D. sembrar alfalfa para la alimentación D. los cuyes. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar. Los sueños D. Violeta son  salir adelante, mejorar su negocio, construir su casa y exportar los cuyes. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles haciendo un total D. 10,950 soles.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Llamocctachi" started its 23rd loan cycle with 21 members. The members have a variety of types of businesses such as: the sale of vegetables, groceries in general, young animals, and sweets, and also the cultivation of vegetables and the raising of livestock. Such is the case of Violeta, who is the secretary of the communal bank. Violeta is married, 26 years old, and has 2 children. Violeta has a store in her house where she sells groceries and general merchandise, which she does every day. In addition, Violeta raises guinea pigs in sheds that she has at her home. She herself is in charge of planting the alfalfa that she feeds to the guinea pigs. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Violeta dreams of getting ahead, improving her business, building her house and exporting her guinea pigs. The members need different amounts of loans, such as 300 Peruvian soles, 600 soles, or 900 soles, making a total of 10,950 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Eufemia Nicolasa

texts.es: Doña Eufemia vive en Healeah, es una mujer activa que ayuda a su esposo con las siembras que cultiva, en tiempos libres trabaja de albañil para surtir los gastos de la siembra, doña Eufemia  recibe una pensión del seguro por largos años que laboro. Con la cual cubre sus gastos. En alimentación, así como gasto en su salud ya  que es diabetes. Para ella no es fácil ya que todo esta con precios alto. Mediante estos financiamientos ha logrado hacer las mejoras a su casa ya que es el medio flexible de pago, con este préstamo podrá reparar el muro en la parte de atrás de su casa que esta en mal estado ante que se caiga todo y gaste mas , para esto comprara, piedra, arena, cemento y poder hacer la mejora para el bienestar de la familia.
texts.en:
Doña Eufemia lives in Healeah. She is very active and helps her husband sow the seeds for the crops that they cultivate. In her free time she works as a mason to supplement the costs of sowing their crops. Doña Eufemia receives a pension for her many years of labor, which she uses to pay her expenses. She is a diabetic and has specific nutritional needs. Being a diabetic is very difficult for her as the cost of treatment is very high. Through the loans she has received she has been able to make improvements to her house and spread out her payments over time. With this loan she will be able to repair the wall behind her house, which is in poor condition, before it falls and costs her even more money. With the loan she will purchase rock, sand and cement to make the repairs to the wall and improve the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rock, sand and cement to repair the wall behind her house, which is in disrepair

loans.name: Mugbateh Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Mugbateh” group. They are small-scale businesspeople in Waterloo small town, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to improve their businesses. With the loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standard will improve so that they can better look after themselves and their children. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata B., pictured on the left.  Fatmata was born in a place called Gbumbato, in southern Sierra Leone. She is now 42 years old. She is married with two children. One of her children is married and the other is in secondary school. For more than 25 years, Fatmata has been selling groundnuts/peanuts. She sells both raw and dried groundnuts. With her share of this loan, she will buy two bags of groundnuts to add to the three bags she is currently selling.

loans.use: To buy more bags of groundnuts

loans.name: Progressive Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Progressive” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Gibril S. K. (left) is the leader of this group. The 58-year-old is married to a businesswoman and they have seven children. Gibril has been a businessman for over 20 years. He sells toothpaste, batteries and bars of soap. With his share of this loan, Gibril will expand his business by buying the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy toothpaste, batteries and bars of soap

loans.name: Tataisuple Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Tataisuple” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of SLL 2,000,000. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mohamed K. (left) is the leader of this group. The 32-year-old is married to a student with no children yet. Mohamed has been a businessman for over three years now. He owns a shop right in the center of Magburaka town where he sells radios, tape recorders, mobile phones, top-up cards, soft drinks, etc. With his share of this loan, Mohamed will expand his business by buying the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy radios, tape recorders, mobile phones, top-up cards, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.name: United Tamemsu Group

texts.en: Lucy J. (left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Lucy was born in Kabala town about 35 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has two children, both of whom are attending primary school. For 10 years now, Lucy has been selling toothpaste, soap, milk, biscuits, etc. This is the first loan that Lucy and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Lucy will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy toothpaste, soap, milk, biscuits, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
Memunatu B. (on the left in the photo) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Mansobrie village, about forty-five years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has five children, two of whom are still attending schools.

For over seventeen years now, Memunatu has been selling fish, rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), etc.

This is the first loan that Memunatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Memunatu will use her SLL 500,000 share of the loan to expand her business. She will buy fish, rice and palm-oil wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more fish, rice and palm-oil wholesale

loans.name: Born Sweet Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Born Sweet” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Haja Memuna B. (on the left in the photo) is the leader of this group. The 45-year-old is married to a businessman and they have six children.

Haja has been a businesswoman for twenty-five years now. She sells gari (a sort of fast food made out of cassava roots), soft drinks and eggs. With her share of this loan, she will buy more of the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy more gari, soft drinks and eggs wholesale

loans.name: Future In Our Hands Group

texts.en:
John C. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. He was born in Makeni about 37 years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has four children: three in primary school and the other a baby.

For over ten years now, John has been selling different type of bags – school bags, ladies’ bags, traveling bags, etc.

This is the first loan that John and his group have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improving their living conditions.

John will use his SLL 500,000 share of the loan to buy different types of bags wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy different types of bags to add to his stock

loans.name: Tamaraneh Traders Group

texts.en:
Rugiatu S. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Sanda village, 32 years ago. She is married to a welder and the couple has three children: two are in primary school and the other is a baby.

For three years now, Rugiatu has been selling cooked rice, meat, fish and vegetables in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone.

This is first loan that Rugiatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Rugiatu will use her SLL 500,000 share of the loan to buy cooking materials like rice, palm-oil, fish, etc. wholesale.

loans.use: To buy cooking materials like rice, palm-oil, fish, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Sagbanneh Group

texts.en:
Aminata T. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Mabanta village twenty-nine years ago. She is married to a diamond dealer and the couple has two children: one is in primary school and the other is a baby.

For five years, Aminata has been selling beans, rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), etc. in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone.

This is the first loan that Aminata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Aminata will use her SLL 500,000 share of the loan to buy more beans, rice and palm-oil wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more beans, rice and palm-oil wholesale

loans.name: Suly Elizabeth

texts.es:
Suly V. de 44 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así por la abundancia de la flor orquídeas,  casas de cemento y calles en proceso de regeneración) de Guayaquil, esta separada de su esposo, ella tiene tres hijos que viven con ella. 

Suly por la desesperante idea de tener un negocio y la falta de oportunidades decidió invertir todos sus ahorros en botones, cierres y hilos y alquilar un local ya que vio mucha demanda para este tipo de negocios ya que habían muchos confucionistas pero nadie que venda los implemento para realizarlo. 

Por la buena decisión que tomo ahora ella es la principal distribuidora de artículos de sastrería de su sector, trabaja sola desde las 07h30 am hasta las 00h30 todos los días. Vende botones, cierres, hilos etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar botones, cierres, hilos, encajes para poderlo surtir mas. En el futuro quiere otros locales de ventas de artículos de sastrería.
texts.en:
Suly is 44 years old and lives in an urban zone of Las Orquídeas (named for the abundance of orchids, cement houses, and streets in the process of regeneration) in Guayaquil. She is separated from her husband, and has 3 children who live with her. Suly had the desperate idea of having her own business, and due to the lack of opportunity, decided to invest all her saving in buttons, zippers and thread, and to rent a locale, since she saw much demand for this type of business. There were many dressmaking shops but no one had these materials to satisfy demand. Due to her good decision, now she is the principal distributor of sewing articles in her sector. She works alone from 7:30 am until 12:30 every day. Suly sells buttons, zippers, thread, etc. With this loan she wants to buy buttons, zippers, thread, and cases to display more. In the future, she wants to open other locales to sell sewing supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MORE BUTTONS, THREAD, AND ZIPPERS TO SELL

loans.name: Lucero Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “Lucero” se reúnen cada treinta días en las oficinas de la unidad de micro finanzas de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el ciclo 11 y está conformado por  18  personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 

Delia, tiene 61 años, es madre soltera,  tiene una hija y es natural de la Santa Teresa de la provincia de Convención del departamento del Cusco. 

Delia nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Lucero”  somos 18 integrantes (15 mujeres y 3 varones) y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Delia trabaja en el área administrativa en el  centro educativo especial de niños “CEBER”.  Ella requiere el crédito para apoyar la educación de su hija que estudia la carrera profesional de turismo en el instituto “ESITUR”.  

Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a lo que se dedican son  a las ventas de  comestibles, venta de productos secos, venta de cuyes, venta de autopartes, venta de panadería, venta de muebles  de madera y otros socios brindan servicios de transportes, empleada, atención de familia, profesora de inicial, lavar ropa y además son profesionales en ingeniería de sistemas y educación.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora de la región sur del país.
texts.en:
The members of the “Lucero” communal bank meet every thirty days in the micro-finance offices of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. Currently this communal bank is in its 11th loan cycle. It is made up of 18 hardworking and entrepreneurial people who look for every opportunity to get ahead and work hard every day to provide a better future for their children. Delia is 61 years old and is a single mother. She has one daughter and is from Santa Teresa, in the province of Convención, in the department of Cusco. Delia tells us, “In my communal bank, Lucero, there are 18 members (15 women and 3 men) and they chose me as the representative of the communal bank to tell the story of my business.” Delia works in administration in the children’s educational center “CEBER.” She needs the loan to pay for her daughter’s education. Her daughter is studying tourism in the “ESITUR” institute. The businesses of the other members are selling grocery items, dry grains, guinea pigs, car parts, working as a domestic servant, a nanny, a kindergarten teacher, and washing clothes. There are also professionals who work in engineering, computer systems, and education. The members value and are grateful for the loan provided through this program and they promise to repay the loan in the established time period. Cusco is a city that is characterized by its archeological attractions, its historic center, its scenic views, and its history. It is a charming city in the southern region of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's education

loans.name: Llankasunchis De Lares Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “Llankasunchis de Lares” se reúnen cada treinta días en la oficina de atención de la unidad de micro finanzas de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Lares. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el ciclo 9 y está conformado por  personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La palabra quechua “Llankasunchis” que traducido al castellano significa “Trabajemos”.   
	
Paulina, tiene 37 años, tiene dos gemelos de 12 años que estudian en la escuela. 

Paulina nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Llankasunchis”  somos 12  integrantes (8 mujeres y 4 varones) y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Paulina tiene un restaurante en la plaza de armas de la ciudad de Lares “Las Gemelas” donde prepara desayuno, almuerzo, cena y comida a pedido del cliente. Paulina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo  azúcar, arroz, papas, verduras, carnes, etc. 

Sus principales  actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a lo que se dedican son  a las ventas de  comida de forma ambulatoria en la plaza de armas de lares que se llama “Asociación de Vianderas de comunidad de Lares”, crianza y venta de animales menores, venta de comestibles, venta de chicha y frutillada y otros socios brindan servicios en la municipalidad de distrital de Lares. Su actividad económica complementaria es la ganadería y la agricultura, ellos venden sus productos en la feria de “Machacancha” los lunes hasta las 2 de la tarde y después se trasladan a vender a la feria de “Cachin” los días martes.           

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank “Llankasunchis de Lares” meet every 30 days in the micro finance offices of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Lares. The community bank is in their ninth loan cycle and is made of up laborers and entrepreneurs who take every chance they get to get ahead and through their daily efforts strive to improve the future of their children. The quechua word "Llankasunchis” means "workers". Paulina is 37 years old and has two 12 year old twins who are attending school. Paulina told us - My community bank "Llankasunchis” is made up of 12 members (8 women and 4 men). They elected me to represent the community bank and describe my economic activities. Paulina has a restaurant call "Las Gemelas" in the the Plaza de Armas in the city of Lares where she prepares breakfast, lunch, dinner, and food specially ordered by her clients. Paulina requires the loan to purchase supplies such as sugar, rice, potatoes, vegetables, meat, etc. Some of the principle economic activities that members of the community bank engage in are: the sale of food on foot in the Plaza de Armas in Lares for the “Asociación de Vianderas de comunidad de Lares”, growing and selling young animals, grocery sales, sale of chicha (corn liquor) and fruit and others offer services in the municipal district of Lares. They complement each others activities because they all work with cattle and agriculture and sell their products in the market of “Machacancha” on Mondays until 2 in the afternoon and then relocate to the “Cachin” market on Tuesdays. The community bank members value the loan and are very grateful. They will pay the loan down according to the terms agreed upon.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paulina requires the loan to purchase supplies such as sugar, rice, potatoes, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood, glue and formica

loans.name: Libert

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él Sr. LIBERT,  el socio tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, Nuestro socio alterna sus actividades con la carpintería y la agricultura, Nuestro socio es agricultor y tiene tierra de cultivos en las que produce papa, maíz, habas; también es carpintero de profesión. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de carpintería.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mr. Libert belongs to the community bank “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción”. He lives in the district of Anta, a province of Anta in the department of Cusco. Mr. Libert is 31 years old and lives with his partner and three children. He is a professional carpenter and a farmer; he uses his land to grow potatoes, corn and beans. Mr Libert is requesting a loan to buy carpentry materials. He gives thanks for the valuable support offered through Kiva and pledges to re-pay his installments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase carpentry materials

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: D. Joséphine est née en 1968 et vit depuis quinze ans environs au quartier Enagnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Joséphine est mariée et mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Joséphine vit avec sa famille à Enagnon. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Joséphine n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Joséphine prépare et vend de la nourriture (riz, haricot, etc.) dans son quartier. Joséphine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Joséphine a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Joséphine sollicite un quatrième prêt, afin de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter le volume de sa production journalière.
texts.en:
D. Joséphine was born in 1968 and has been living for fifteen years in the Enagnon district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married and the mother of three children, who have all attended school. She lives with her family in Enagnon. The couple share in covering their various family expenses. Joséphine never attended school. To provide for herself and her children, she makes food and sells it (rice, beans, etc.) in her district. Joséphine gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has already benefited from three loans with ALIDé that have all been repaid. Facing the more and more numerous demands of her customers, Joséphine is requesting a fourth loan in order to bolster her business and to increase her daily production volume.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of rice, beans, and condiments for sauce

loans.name: Bruno

texts.es:
Don Bruno es un hombre trabajador y padre de familia de cinco hijos, tiene la edad de 38 años, y ha trabajado en la agricultura desde joven en la ciudad de Teustepe, en tierra propia heredad que dieron sus padres. Por motivo de sequía le fue mal en las siembras lo que impulso vender parte de sus tierras dinero con el que se traslada a la capital y pone una pulpería ya que tiene que administrar bien el negocio para poder mantener a su familia ya que tiene aun tres hijos estudiando. 

El fin de este financiamiento es para invertir en productos para su venta como: granos básicos, golosinas, cereales, carne, pollo, gaseosas y otros productos de consumo diario con el objetivo de vender más y captar clientela.
texts.en:
Don Bruno is a hard working man and the father of five children. He is 38 years old and worked as a farmer since a very young age in the town of Teustepe, on his own land that he inherited from his parents. Because of the drought, his harvesting wasn't going well and he had to sell part of his land, using the money to start a business. The reason for this loan is to purchase products for reselling, like grains, candy, cereal, meat, chicken, sodas and other products of daily consumption so he can sell more and gain more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food Products for Reselling

loans.name: Ricchariy Llaqta Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “Ricchariy Llaqta” se reúnen cada treinta días en la casa del socio Gregorio en la comunidad D. Choquecancha del distrito D. Lares D. la provincia D. calca. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el ciclo 4 y está conformado por  personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La palabra quechua “Ricchariy Llaqta” que traducido al castellano significa “Pueblo Despierta”.   
	
Julia, tiene 37 años, tiene dos hijos y vive en la comunidad D. Choquecancha. 

Julia nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Ricchariy Llaqta”  somos 10  integrantes y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio D. mi actividad económica. Julia venD. artesanía en la comunidad D. Choquecancha y requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como lana,  anilina e hilos. 
 
Sus principales  actividades económicas D. algunos D. los socios son;  venta D.  comida, venta D. artesanía y otros socios brindan servicios como albañiles. Su actividad económica complementaria es la ganadería y la agricultura, ellos venden sus productos en las ferias D. la ciudades D. Calca, Lares y por el valle. 

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank “Ricchariy Llaqta” get together every month in the the house of one of their members, Gregorio, located in the Choquecancha community in the Lares district of the Calca department. The community bank is currently in its fourth cycle and is maD. up of hard working and enterprising people who look for opportunities to get ahead in every moment, and to give their children a better future with their daily efforts. The quecha word “Ricchariy Llaqta” means "Awakened People". Julia is 37 years old, has two children and lives in the Choquecancha community. She was chosen out of the 10 members of her community bank “Ricchariy Llaqta” to give an account of her business. Julia sells handicrafts in Choquecancha and needs a loan to purchase materials such as wool, aniline and thread. The bank's members mainly work selling food and handicrafts and bricklaying. Others work with livestock or in agriculture, and sell their products in fairs in the valley and in the cities of Calca and Lares. The members are very grateful for the valuable loan granted to them by Kiva and pledge to re-pay their installments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool, aniline and thread

loans.name: Yesebella Karen

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Yesebella,  ella tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración de su propia fotocopiadora y ti peos en un stand ubicado frente a la universidad particular Andina de Cusco, L a socia tiene alquilado un espacio para la venta de snack, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales de fotocopiadoras, comprará papeles A-4, tintas de colores y negro para la impresora y  papeles de tamaños diversos para los planos y gigantografías. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar tintes de impresión y papeles.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Yesebella, 23 , is single and is a member of the “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN” communal bank; she lives in Anta district, Anta province, Cusco Department. Yesebella is single and she alternates her household chores with running her photocopy and typing service business in a stand located across from the private, Andina de Cusco, university. She also rents a space to sell snacks. She is asking for funds to buy photocopy supplies, A-4 size paper, color and black inks for the printer and paper in various sizes for plans and oversize photos. She asks for funds to buy paper and inks. She is grateful for and values the support offered through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy printer ink and paper.

loans.name: March 29Th Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento 29 D. MARZO es un banco que está inicianto en su primer ciclo y el Banco está conformado por 8 Integrantes las señoras se dedican al comercio, servicio y venta D. verduras y otros,todos los socio son personas responsables y trabajadoras que se conocen y se garantizan entre ellos.

El Sr. JUAN es el presidente del Banco, esta casado y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, el es chofer el se dedica a la servicio D. radio taxi y con el prestamo lograra hacer mantenimiento D. su movilidad para seguier trabajando sin ninguna otra falla mecanica, el se dedica a esta actividad hace vaR. años, es muy trabajador y responsable por eso fue elegido como presidente del banco D. emprendimiento

La Sra. LILIAM es la secretaria en el Banco esta casada y ella tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar y se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y con el prestamo comprará más mercaderias para su negocio D. esta forma mejorara sus ingresos economicos y aumento D. su capital D. trabajo. 

La Sra. JOSEFA  ella es la tesorera del banco y tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y con el prestamo compra D. más mercaderias para su negocio y D. esta forma mejorara sus ingresos, y su calidad D. vida y aumento D. capital D. trabajo. 

Todos los socios estan agradecidos con emprenderr y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The "29 D. Marzo" (March 29th) communal bank is beginning its first loan cycle. It is maD. up of 8 members, working in traD., services, and the sale of vegetables and other things. All of the members are responsible, hard-working people who know and trust one another. Juan is the president of the group. He is married with two young children, and works as a driver with a radio taxi company. With the loan he will make repairs and improvements to his car so that he can keep working without having any more mechanical problems. He has been doing this work for many years. He is very hard-working and responsible, which is why he was chosen as president of the communal bank. Liliam, the secretary of the communal bank, is married with three school-age children. She sells groceries. With the loan she will buy more stock for her business, enabling her to increase her income and her working capital. Josefa is the treasurer of the group. She has two school-age children. She also sells groceries and will use the loan to buy more stock for her business, thereby increasing her income and her quality of life, and giving her more working capital. All the members of the group are grateful to the field partner Emprender, and to Kiva, for the confidence they have shown in them by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenence

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy salchipapa (fried potato and sausage) ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: Juan de Dios es un cliente que solicita credito por primera vez en la institucion por recomendacion de su Padre quien es cliente antiguo del grupo Jesus te Ama, el trabaja con su taxi por las tardes y durante la mañana se dedica a tramitar titulos de provision nacional para la Universidad Evangelica de Santa Cruz, el dinero sera invertido en la refaccion del automovil del que es propietario, ya que dias atras Juan de Dios retorno a recoger su automovil de la Av, Camacho para regesar a su casa pero se dio cuenta de que el automotor habia sufrido un choque directo en el tren delantero, dejando al mismo en pesimas condiciones, el Sr. Juan de Dios tambien vende carme ya que desde muy pequeño su Papa le enseño viajaban a loss pueblos en busca de ganado para comprar y despues venderlos en el mercado de la zona hoy en dia el cliente tiene el objetivo de abrir su propia carniceria  y hasta el momento a logrado ahorrar para comprar equipos y tomar un anticretico, solo le falta una sierra y unos ganchos lo que nos dara como resultado un cliente a largo plazo, el esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Juan de Dios is a client who is requesting a loan for the first time at the institution on the recommendation of his father who is a former client of the group Jesus te Ama. He drives a taxi in the evenings and in the mornings, he processes qualification certificates for the University Evangelica de Santa Cruz. The money will be invested in the repair of his car. Several days ago, when Juan de Dios went to Av, Camacho to get his car in order to return home, he realized that the vehicle had been hit in the front wheel assembly, leaving it in terrible condition. Juan de Dios also sells meat. Since he was very young, his father taught him the business and they traveled to the villages in search of livestock to buy and then sell in the local market. Today the client’s goal is to open his own butcher shop and so far he has managed to save money to buy equipment and enter into a rental contract. He just needs a saw and some hooks which will enable him to gain long term customers. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting him with a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle Maintenance

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: La Sra. Leticia es una persona joven, alegre y muy trabajadora. Esta casada, ella tiene una tienda donde vende accesorios, repuestos y celulares, pero además realiza mantenimiento y reparación de celulares. Ella tomo algunos cursos donde aprendió esta actividad. Su esposo, Freddy, trabaja como empleado en una fabrica de textiles desde hace tres años. Ellos viven en una casa de alquiler en la zona de Pampahasi, zona que se encuentra a 25 minutos del centro de la ciudad. Tienen dos pequeños hijos a quienes quieren mucho, el mayor tiene cuatro años y el siguiente año estará en kínder. Uno de los mayores anhelos de Leticia y Freddy es ahorrar lo suficiente para poder comprar una casita. Leticia trabajó con nuestra institución un préstamo anterior en el cuál demostró ser muy puntual y responsable con sus pagos. En una ocasión sufrió un robo en su tienda, pero ella no se rindió y siguió trabajando. Actualmente, ella continúa trabajando y espera poder ver a sus hijos como profesionales. En este momento solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su tienda.  Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Leticia is young, cheerful, and hardworking. She's married and has a shop where she sells cell phones, cell phone accessories, and spare phone parts; her shop also offers cell phone maintenance and repair. She took courses to learn these activities. Her husband, Freddy, has worked in a textile factory for three years. They live in a rented house in the neighborhood of Pampahsi, 25 minutes from the center of the city. They have two small children whom they love very much. The oldest is 4 years old and next year he will begin kindergarten. One of Leticia and Freddy's dreams is to save enough money to be able to buy a small house. Leticia worked with our institution for a previous loan and proved herself to be very punctual and responsible with the repayment. On one occasion she suffered a robbery in her shop, but she didn't give up and kept working. Currently she continues to work and hopes that her children will be able to work as professionals when they grow up. At this moment she is asking for a loan to add more things to her store. She's very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they extend by granting loans.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chargers and batteries

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El Sr. Daniel tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada y es soltero vive con su Mama y sus Hermanas a quienes el mantiene con su trabajo que tiene como actividad la de chofer propietario en una empresa de radio taxi GOLD, cuyas rutas principales son del centro de la ciudada hacia la zona sud, es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora que siempre ve por el bienestar de su Madre y sus hermanas. Su deseo del Sr. Daniel es el de comprar una casita para su Mama para que pueda vivir tranquila su vejes, El crédito solicitado es para mantenimiento preventivo de su vehiculo, ya que es su unica fuente de ingresos cada temporada le hace el mantenimiento para que su vehiculo no presente fallas a la hora de salir a trabajar, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Daniel is 30 years old, lives in a rented house and is single. He lives with his mother and sisters, whom he supports with his work as an owner-driver for the GOLD taxi cab company. The company’s main routes are between the city centre and the south of the city. He is a responsible and very hard-working person, always thinking of the wellbeing of his mother and sisters. He would like to buy a small house where his mother can grow old peacefully. The loan he has requested is to pay for some preventive maintenance work on his vehicle. As it represents his only source of income, he services his car every year so that it doesn’t break down while he is working. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in him and for the approval of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Diana Janina

texts.es:
Diana P. de 26 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso (llamado así por sus abundantes lomas de tierra y sus casas de caña) de Guayaquil. Su esposo le ayuda en haciendo la masa de pan, ellos tienen dos hijos.

Diana y su esposo se conocieron en una panificadora, pero cuando se casaron los liquidaron y tuvieron que ir a trabajar a otro lugar, por la falta de oportunidades tuvieron que invertir sus ahorros en un horno y masa de pan, para poder independizarse y empezar el negocio de la panadería.   

Ahora su esposo se encarga de hacer las masas de panes desde las 04h30 hasta las 06h00 am que están listos, Diana se encarga de atender la panadería y vender los panes. La panadería la tienen ubicada en la parte delantera de su casa ya que no tienen dinero para un local.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina, huevos, lácteos para su panadería. En el futuro quiere separar su negocio de su casa ya que tiene muy poco espacio para vivir.
texts.en:
Diana P. is 26 years old and lives in a suburban area of Guayaquil called Paraíso (It's called "Paradise" for its abundant soil and reed houses.) Her husband helps her make bread dough and they have two children. Diana and her husband met in an industrial bakery, but when they got married they were let go and had to find work elsewhere. Due to lack of opportunities, they had to invest their savings in an oven and bread dough to start their business -- the bakery. Her husband is in charge of making the bread dough. He starts at 4:30 a.m. and finshes at 6:00 a.m. when they are ready. Diana takes care of the bakery, assists customers, and sells bread. The bakery is in the front part of their home since they don't have money for a space. They want to buy flour, eggs, and milk products for their bakery with the loan money. They would also like to separate the business from their home in the future since they don't have much room to live in.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Flour, eggs, milk products

loans.name: Mario Octavio

texts.es: El Sr. Mario, tiene 30 años de edad y vive en la casa de sus papas, se encuentra casado con doña Sarait que tiene como actividad una tienda de ropa y calzados, con quien tiene dos hijos, son un apareja muy unida siempre colaborandose en el trabajo y en la familia, El Sr. Mario tiene como actividad principal ser chofer propietario de una camioneta de carga y como actividad secundaria una tienda de barrio, el crédito solicitado es para la compra de mercaderia para la tienda de la esposa, pues tiene una oferta de compra de calzados por cajas, es muy trabajador siempre velando el bienestar de su familia, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianz a brindada en la otorgacion dle credito.
texts.en:
Mario is 30 years old and lives in his parents' house. He is married to Sarait, who runs a store that sells clothing and shoes. They have two children together and they are a very tight pair, always working together both in their work and with their family. Mario's main job is as the owner and driver of a cargo truck. His second job is running a neighborhood store. Mario is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise for his wife's store, as they have an offer to buy boxes of shoes. He is a very hard worker and is always watching out for his family's well-being. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they show in granting him this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: EL SEÑOR JOSE LUIS SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE PUBLICO EN LA LINEA DE TAXI TRUFI 123, ES LA RUTA A LA ZONA DONDE EL VIVE USPA USPA,  TRABAJA COMO CHOFER 16 AÑOS Y CON MOVILIDAD PROPIA DESDE HACE 6 AÑOS, TIENE CASA PROPIA, ESTA CASADO Y TIENE 3 HIJOS, HA DEMOSTRADO SER RESPONSABLE CON LOS PAGOS DE SUS CUOTAS YA QUE TRANAJA CON LA INSTITUCION MAS DE 2 AÑOS YA QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN SU TERCER CICLO Y EL CREDITO SACO PARA LA COMPRA DE UNA CAJA MECANICA Y RADIADOR PARA SU MOVILIDAD, YA QUE LA CAJA DE SU VEHICULO TIENE FALLAS Y NO PERMITE REALIZAR BIEN SU TRABAJO. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Jose Luis works in public transport on the Taxi Trufi route 123 to Uspa Uspa, where he lives. He has been working as a driver for 16 years, with own vehicle since six years ago. He is married with three children and owns a home. He has demonstrated his responsibility with repayments; he has been working with the institution for more than two years and is already in his third cycle. As the transmission on his vehicle is faulty and prevents him from doing his job properly, this loan is being used to buy a mechanical gearbox and a radiator for his vehicle. He is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust extended to him with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a mechanical gearbox, a radiator, and other items

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Doña Maria de edad de 56 años, se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa usada, y la venta de fritanga  desde hace varios años logro vender, tiene la ayuda de sus dos hijas que aun estudian pero se apoyan entre si para lograr los objetivos ya que no tienen la ayuda de su compañero.
Cuando inicio lo hizo con poca ropa, con dinero proveniente de ahorro de lavado y planchado, lo que quiere comprar  paca de ropa y prendas de oro y lograr mejores ventas, la captación de clientes nuevos, mejores utilidades. Sus planes es poder ayudar  a sus hijas a que logren culminar sus estudios a si como promoverlas al negocio ya que ahora en día por la falta de desempleo hay que aprender a comercializar para poder lograr un equilibrio y no fracasar. Con este financiamiento es una puerta para lograr mejor invertir.
texts.en:
María is 56 years old and sells used clothing; several years ago she also began selling fried food. She has the help of her two daughters, although they are still in school. The three support each other in achieving their goals since María does not have the benefit of a partner. She opened the business with only a small amount of clothing to sell and with money saved from washing and ironing. She would like to buy bulk clothing and gold jewelry to improve sales, attract new customers, and increase profits. She wants to help her daughters finish their studies and learn to promote the business, since today there is high unemployment and it is necessary to learn to commercialize to stabilize a business and prevent it from failing. This financing is the door to successfully improving her investment.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase bulk clothing and gold jewelry to improve sales

loans.name: Orlando Felipe

texts.es: Don Orlando es un hombre trabajador, dedicado a su familia, tiene la edad de 58 años, junto a su esposa trabajan para lograr cubrir los gastos del hogar ya que procrearon cuatro hijos, su esposa es conserje y el trabaja como guarda de seguridad. Entre sus dificultades es que fue asaltado y no logro recuperarse es por eso busca un trabajo fijo. Y lograr un equilibrio. Con este inversión quiere comprar zinc nuevo para cambiar parte del techo ya que se le pasa el agua, lo que es una prioridad el mejoramiento de su vivienda para lograr cada día un techo en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Orlando is a hard-working man and dedicated to his family. He is 58 years old and works together with his wife to cover their household expenses, since they have four children. His wife is a custodian and he works as a security guard. Among their difficulties is that Orlando was attacked and unable to recover, so he is still looking for a permanent job and to find his balance again. With this investment he wants to buy new zinc sheets to replace a part of their roof that is leaking. Improving their home with a roof in good condition is a priority.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase zinc to replace a roof in poor condition

loans.name: Solidarias De Emprender Group

texts.es:
EL BANCO DE EMPRENDIMIENTO LAS SOLIDARIAS DE EMPRENDER ES UN GRUPO DE CLIENTES QUE SE CARACTERIZAN POR LA DIVERSIDAD DE ACTIVIDADES QUE REALIZAN, TENEMOS DOS VARONES DENTRO DE ESTA BANCA.

LA PRESIDENTA ES LA SRA. VICTORIA,  ES CASADA, TIENE TRES HIJOS PEQUEÑOS, SU ESPOSO ES CHOFER DE SU PROPIA MOVILIDAD, ELLA REALIZA COSTURA DE BUSOS Y CHALECOS DEPORTIVOS DEL MATERIAL DE POLAR, ESTA TELA ES BARATA Y CALIENTITA, AUNQUE TIENE SU CASA PROPIA ELLA DESEA DARLES MAS COMODIDAD A SUS HIJOS Y SU SUEÑO ES HACER CONSTRUIR SU CASA Y CONTAR CON TODOS LOS SERVICIOS BASICOS, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA TELA AL POR MAYOR PARA LA REALIZACION DE LOS BUSOS DEPORTIVOS YA QUE ESTA TEMPORADA DE FRIO TIENE MUCHA VENTA.

EL SR. HERNAN  TIENE UN SNACK DE POLLOS A LA BROASTER SU NEGOCIO ES COMPARTIDO CON SU HERMANA, EL JOVEN ES SOLTERO Y ES EL QUE MAS LE AYUDA A SU MAMA SU SUEÑO ES INDEPENDIZARSE  Y TENER SU PROPIO LOCAL Y A SU NOMBRE, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA INSUMOS PARA LA ELABORACION DE LOS POLLOS.

LA  SEÑORA LILIAN TIENE EL NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE COMIDA, ES DIVORSIADA, CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD SUSTENTA A SUS TRES HIJOS, LA MAYOR ESTA A PUNTO DE SER ABOGADA Y LOS OTROS MENORES AÚN ESTAN EN COLEGIO, ES UNA PERSONA MUY LUCHADORA,ALEGRE Y EMPRENDEDORA SIEMPRE TRABAJANDO POR EL BIENESTAR DE SUS HIJOS. 

TODAS LAS SOCIAS SON PERSONAS RESPONSABLES Y DINAMICAS QUE QUIEREN SACAR ADELANTE A SUS FAMILIAS PARA ASI PODER MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE TODA SU FAMILILA, ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDAS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Solidarias de Emprender” is a group of clients who are known for their different business activities. The group includes two men.

Sra. Victoria is the group president. She is married and has three young children. Her husband is a chauffeur who has his own vehicle. Victoria is a seamstress who makes sweatshirts and pullovers made of fleece. This type of material is warm and inexpensive. Victoria wants to make her children as comfortable as possible, so she wants to have her own home. Her dream is to build a house and have all the basic services installed. Using the proceeds from her loan, she plans to buy fabric in bulk so that she can make sweatshirts in order to generate more sales during the cold season.

Sr. Hernan owns a snack business in which he sells roasted chickens with his sister. This young man is single and supports his mother. His dream is to become independent and acquire his own location under his name. The money from his loan will be used to buy supplies for cooking chickens.

Sra. Lilian has a business selling food. She is divorced, so her business helps to support her three children. The oldest child is close to becoming a lawyer, while the two younger children are in high school. Lilian is a determined, cheerful, and enterprising woman who always works for the welfare of her children.

All of the members are responsible and dynamic individuals who want to succeed on behalf of their families so that they can improve their quality of life. They are extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in them by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric in bulk

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito D. Anta provincia D. Anta departamento D. Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. ERNESTINA,  La socia es casada y vive con su conyugue y aún no tienen hijos y es uno D. sus grandes sueños el poder tenerlos, mientras Nuestra socia se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza D. animales menores, Nuestra socia tiene terrenos D. cultivos en Anta, ella solicita el préstamo para hacer D. esto un capital D. trabajo y aumentar animales menores tales como algunos cuyes y aves D. corral, para la venta.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ernestina belongs to the “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN” ("Virgin of the Immaculate Conception") communal bank. She lives in the district of Anta, in Anta province, in the department of Cusco. Ernestina is married and lives with her husband. They do not yet have children, and one of their great dreams is to be able to have some. In the meantime, Ernestina works in agriculture and raises small livestock. She has fields in Anta where she grows her crops. She is requesting the loan in order to use the funds as working capital and increase the number of small animals she is raising to sell, such as guinea pigs and poultry. She values and appreciates the support provided to her in this way, and she is committed to paying off the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital; buying more small livestock, such as guinea pigs and poultry

loans.name: Teresa Dominga

texts.es: La señora Teresa es una mujer muy trabajadora, con 46 años de edad, desde joven ha trabajado para sobresalir adelante con su familia, ya que es de poco recursos económicos y con lo que gana de salario como conserje es apenas para la canasta básica, procreo cinco hijos, junto a su esposo se esfuerzan para lograr las mejora a su pequeña casa, el trabaja como jardinero su salario es bajo, pero es fijo. Con el crédito anterior logro levantar un pequeño muro para reguardar mas su propiedad, con este financiamiento comenzara hacer las paredes de concreto, comprara los materiales necesario  para llevar a cabo la construcción y poder terminarla a largo plazo ya que todo esta en altos precios. Y tiene que levantar la casa toda de concreto, así como hacer divisiones, embaldosar, ya que es de tierra para una mejor higiene y gozar de un un techo en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Teresa is 46 years old and a very hard-working mother. Since she was young she has worked to be successful to benefit her family, which has few financial resources. The salary she earns as a custodian is barely enough for her family's basic grocery needs; she has five children. She and her husband struggle to improve their small house; he works as a gardener and receives a low salary, but it is a steady job. With her last loan, Teresa was able to build a small wall to shelter her property. With this loan, she will begin to build concrete walls by buying the materials needed to complete the construction and to be able to finish it in the long term, since the prices are high right now. She needs to build the entire house from concrete, divide the rooms, and lay down tile. The house is made of earth, and these improvements will make conditions more hygienic.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for concrete walls such as rocks, sand, and cement

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. YURI,  la socia tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente  y tiene 3 hijos, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el apoyo a su conyugue que tiene un taller mecánico y prestan todo tipo de  servicio en el taller está ubicado en el distrito de San Sebastían. La socia solicita el préstamo para ayudar en el taller a comprar algunas herramientas.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Yuri belongs to the community bank “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción”. She lives in the Anta district in the province of Anta, in the department of Cusco. Yuri is 34 years old and lives with her partner and three children. She attends to her home duties with the help of her husband, who runs an auto repair that offers a complete range of services in the San Sebastian district. Yuri is applying for a loan to help purchase some tools for the auto repair. She is very grateful for the valuable support offered by Kiva and pledges to complete all her repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for an auto repair

loans.name: Santisima Trinidad - Sallali. Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Santísima Trinidad inicia su ciclo 1 con 7 socias. Las socias son D. la comunidad D. Sallalli, Distrito D.  Vinchos.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como es el caso D. la Señora Juana que es conviviente y tiene 8 hijos, Juana se dedica a la compra y venta D. quesos, Juana inicio su negocio con la venta D. cereales y quesos, que vendía en la ciudad D. Ayacucho y D. la ciudad compraba panes que vendía en su comunidad, Juana tiene proyectado implementar una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, con el préstamo que obtendrá comprará abarrotes. Los sueños D. Juana son tener una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 100 soles, 300 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total D. 1,600 soles.
texts.en:
The “Santísima Trinidad” (Holy Trinity) communal bank begins its first cycle with 7 members who are from Sallalli, Vinchos district. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities. An example is Juana who lives with her life partner and their 8 children. Juana is a cheese merchant. She started out selling cereals and cheese in Ayacucho and she would bring back bread from the city to sell in her community. Juana plans to set up a grocery store in her home and will use the loan to buy stock items. Juana’s dream is to have a grocery store in her home. The members all need loans of varying amounts: 100 soles, 300 soles, 600 soles, totaling a 1600 sol group loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Kiara Sumac

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. KIARA,  ella tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera,  Nuestra socia alterna sus estudios con el comercio minorista, ella se dedica a atender la tienda de abarrotes que tiene con su mamá en casa, Nuestra socia en su tiempo libre se dedica a administrar y atender su tienda. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como azúcar, fideos, arroz, leche entre otros productos básicos.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner belongs to the Virgin of the Immaculate Conception village bank and lives in the Anta district in the Anta province of Cusco, Peru. Her name is Kiara and she is 19 years old and single. She juggles her education and her job as a retail saleswoman, running a small store that sells groceries out of her mother's home. She tends to customers in the store during her free time. She is seeking a loan to buy more inventoyr such as sugar, pasta, rice, milk and other basics. She is grateful for the support she is receving through this loan and commits to pay her debt on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory such as sugar, pasta, rice, milk and other basics

loans.name: Los Alegres De Anyaypampa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Alegres de Anyaypampa inicia su ciclo 1 con 10 socias. Las socias son de la comunidad de Anyaypampa, Distrito de  Vinchos. Las actividades principales de la comunidad son la crianza de truchas, agricultura y ganadería.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como es el caso de la Señora Margarita que es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, Margarita junto a su esposo se dedican a la crianza de truchas en su comunidad, ella menciona que antes de este negocio su esposo solo se dedicaba a la agricultura y era difícil mantener a sus hijos, fue así que comenzaron con la crianza de truchas en el río de su comunidad, empezaron con una poza actualmente tiene 18 pozas, sus ventas al inicio lo realizaban en la ciudad de Ayacucho, actualmente venden en la misma comunidad porque vienen los compradores. Margarita junto a otras familias conformaron una asociación y esperan seguir creciendo con su empresa. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de alimento balanceado para truchas. Los sueños de Margarita son tener un restaurante para vender las truchas.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 100 soles, 300 soles, 500 soles haciendo un total de 4,800 soles.
texts.en:
The Happy People from Anyapampa village bank is beginning its first cycle with ten members, all from the community of Anyapampa in the Vinchos District. Most of the people in the community engage in fishing, agriculture and raising cattle. The members of this group work in various businesses as is the case with Margarita. She lives with her partner with whom she has 4 children. Together they raise trout in their community; she recounts that before they started this business, her partner only worked in agriculture and it was difficult to support their children, which is why they started to raise trout in the community river. They began with one deep pool and now they have 18. They first started selling in the city of Ayacucho but now sell in their own community because the buyers come to them. Margarita formed a group with some of her relatives and they hope to keep growing the business. Her loan will be used to buy balanced feed for the trout. Margarita dreams of having a restaurant where she can sell her trout. The group members need different amounts of loans like $35, $100, or $175 for a total of $1700.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of nutritionally balanced fish food

loans.name: Maria Parado De Bellido Ii Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Maria P. B. II inicia su ciclo 1 con 13 socias. Las socias son D. la Distrito D. Paras, Provincia D.  Cangallo, se ubica a 3 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Las actividades principales D. la comunidad son la agricultura, ganadería y el comercio.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. animales menores, abarrotes en general, comida, productos veterinarios y panadería.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Norma que es presidenta del Banco Comunal y es socia hace 1 año y medio, Norma es casada y tiene 3 hijos, Norma tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, ropa, calzados, verduras, frutas, su negocio lo inicio en casa alquilada con pocos productos, actualmente tiene local propio y granD., actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, verduras, frutas. Los sueños D. Norma son que sus hijos sean profesionales, comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 500soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total D. 14,200 soles.
texts.en:
The Maria P. B. village bank is starting its first cycle with 13 members, all from the Paras district in the Cangallo provine, 3 hours from the city of Ayacucho, Peru. Most members of the community work in agriculture, livestock, or sales. The group members work in various types of businesses like selling small animals, groceries, food, veterinary products, or bread. Normal is the president of the village bank and has been a member for a year and a half. She is married with 3 children.
