She runs a small store in her home where she sells groceries, clothes, shoes, vegetables, and fruit. She started her business in a rented home with very few products; now she has her own locale which is much larger and her husband helps her with the business. Her loan will be used to buy sugar, vegetables, and fruit. Norma dreams of helping her children to have careers and to someday buy a car to transport her products. The group members need different loan amounts like $175, $210, and $350 for a total of $5000.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Meiry

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. MEIRY,  ella tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera,  Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades con la docencia, ella es profesora de inicial del jardín niño Jesus de Praga; y complementando sus actividades  ella cría animales menores; sólo para pasar su tiempo libre ocupada. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar animalitos (pollitos).

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
MEIRY, 24, is a member of the “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN” communal bank; she lives in Anta district, Anta province, Cusco department. She is single and works as a teacher at the Jesus de Praga kindergarten; she also raises small farm animals to have something to do in her spare time. She needs funding to buy chicks. She is grateful for and values the support given through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks.

loans.name: San Martin De Cangallo Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Martín de Cangallo inicia su primer ciclo  con 11 socias. Las socias son de la Distrito de Cangallo, Provincia de  Cangallo, se ubica a 3 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Las actividades principales de la comunidad son la agricultura, ganadería y el comercio.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de ropa, cereales, animales menores, restaurante, peluquería, tienda de abarrotes.
Como es el caso de la Señora Sonia que es socia hace año y medio, Sonia es casada y tiene 3 hijos, Sonia vende ropa variada, inicio su negocio vendiendo lencería, pequeñas joyas, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y lo vende en su Distrito y también en ferias. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de ropa. Los sueños de Sonia son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios secundarios y luego estudien la universidad en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 500soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total de 5,900 soles.
texts.en:
The San Martin de Cangallo community bank is starting its first cycle with 11 members. The members are from Cangallo, a Peruvian district about 3 hours from the city of Ayacucho. The most common lines of work in the area are farming, raising livestock and commerce. The members operate various businesses: clothing sales, cereal farming, animal rearing, restaurants, hairdressers, groceries. A case in point is Sra. Sonia who has been a member for a year and a half. Sonia is married and has 3 children. She sells a variety of clothing, having started with lingerie and small jewelry pieces. She buys her products in Lima and sells them in Cangallo and area markets. She will use her loan to buy stocks of clothing. Sonia hopes that her children will finish high school and then go on to college in Ayacucho. The members need a range of sums: 500 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, for a total of 5,900 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. MARCELINA,  ella tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 menores hijos, Nuestra socia alterna su trabajo con el comercio minorista, ella compra y vende animales menores y vende comidas en la plaza central de Anta todos los días, Nuestra socia se dedica a este negocio desde hace 10 años. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ingredientes para elaborar comidas y vender. 

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION community bank and lives in Anta in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. Her name is Sra. Marcelina. She is 56 years old and married with 2 children, both minors. She does many things to make a living: she operates a corner shop; she buys and sells animals; and she goes out every day to sell prepared food in Anta's central plaza. Marcelina has operated this business for more than 10 years. She is applying for a loan so that so that she can buy ingredients for making the prepared dishes she sells. Marcelina is grateful for the support offered by this measure and is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario De Huayhuas Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Rosario de Huayhuas inicia su primer ciclo  con 11 socias. Las socias son de la Comunidad de Huayhuas, Provincia de Huanta. Las actividades principales de la comunidad son la agricultura, ganadería.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de animales menores, cereales, abarrotes en general, también servicios de mecánica y herrería.
Como es el caso de la Señora Herlinda que es secretaria de su Banco Comunal, Herlinda es casada y tiene 3 hijos, tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, además se dedica a la herrería, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo, su préstamo será invertido en la compra de abarrotes. Los sueños de Herlinda son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una tienda de herramientas en la ciudad de Huanta.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total de 4,600 soles.
texts.en:
The Virgen Rosario de Huayhuas community bank is starting its first cycle with 11 memebers. The members lives in Huayhuas in the Peruvian "provincia" of Huanta. The main lines of work in the town are farming and animal-rearing. The members operate various businesses: animal sales; cereal farming; corner groceries; and repair shops. A case in point is Sra. Herlinda who is the secretary of the community bank. Herlinda is married and has 3 children. She operates a shop in her house where she sells everyday groceries and hardware products. She operates the business with some help from her husband. She will use the loan to stock her grocery. Herlinda hopes to see her children take up professional careers and to own an hardware store in the city of Huanta. The members need different loan sums: 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, for a total of 4,600 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Various.

loans.name: Espiritu Santo De Anchaq Wasi Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Espiritu Santo de Anchaq Wasi inicia su primer ciclo  con 10 socias. Las socias son de la Comunidad de Anchac Huasi, Distrito de Vinchos. Las actividades principales de la comunidad son la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de truchas.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de cereales, animales menores, tienda de abarrotes.
Como es el caso de la Señora Julia que es la presidenta del Banco comunal, Julia es casada y atiene 4 hijos, Julia se dedica a la venta de cereales que compra en las diferentes comunidades de la región y los comercializa en la ciudad de Pisco y Cañete. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de cereales, los sueños de Julia son comprar un terreno en ayacucho y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total de 3,500 soles.
texts.en:
The Espiritu Santo de Anchaq Wasi (Anchaq Wasi Holy Spirit) communal bank starts its first cycle with 10 members from Anchac Huasi community, Vinchos district. The community’s main activities are agriculture, cattle-raising and trout-raising. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities like: sale of cereals, small animal sales, grocery stores. Such is Julia’s case. She is the communal bank president; she’s married and has 4 children. Julia sells cereals that she buys in the various communities in the region and sells them in the cities of Pisco and Cañete. She will use the funds to buy cereals. Julia’s dreams are to buy a piece of property in Ayacucho and that her children become professionals. The members need loans in varying amounts: 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, totaling 3500 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Jeronima

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito D. Anta provincia D. Anta departamento D. Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Jerónima,  ella tiene 53 años D. edad, es separada y tiene 1 hijo, Nuestra socia alterna su trabajo con el comercio minorista, ella venD. comida en la plaza principal del pueblo, también se dedica en la época D. siembra y cosecha al cultivo D. papa, maíz, verduras; Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos e ingredientes para su negocio.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jerónima, 53, is a member of the “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN” communal bank; she lives in Anta district, Anta province, Cusco department. She is separated and has a son. She alternates her work with retail selling prepared meals in the town’s main square. During planting and harvesting seasons, though, she also farms corn, potato and vegetables. She needs funds to buy ingredients and supplies for her business. She is grateful for and values the support given through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. HIPOLITA,  ella tiene  52 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo menor, Nuestra socia alterna sus labores del hogar con la agricultura y el comercio minorista, Nuestra socia vende verduras al por menor en el mercado central de Iscuchaka en Anta, la socia también tiene ganados y trabaja de forma disciplinada repartiendo su tiempo en todos estos negocios, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
HIPOLITA, 52, is a member of the “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN” communal bank; she lives in Anta district, Anta province, Cusco department. She is a single mother of one minor son. She alternates her domestic chores with farming and retail. She sells vegetables at retail in Iscuchaka’s central market in Anta but also raises cattle; she is very disciplined about dividing her time between both these businesses. She needs funds to buy vegetables at wholesale. She is grateful for and values the support offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. IRMA,  ella tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, Nuestra socia alterna sus labores del hogar con la administración de su tienda abarrotes; y la socia también alterna con la agricultura y la ganadería, ella tiene animales vacunos y tierras de cultivos de maíz y papa; Nuestra socia vende verduras, maíz, papa en su tienda de abarrotes para implementar los productos y está en este negocio desde hace 15 años. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de abarrotes para implementar su tienda con productos básicos como leche, azúcar, arroz, fideos entre otros.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner is a member of the Virgin of the Immaculate Conception village bank and lives in the Anta District of the Anta province of Cusco, Peru. Her name is Irma nad she is 53 years old and married. She juggles her household chores with running her small grocery store. She also works in agriculture and raises livestock. She raises cattle and has fields where she raises corn and potatoes. She sells vegetables, corn, and potatoes in her store and has run this business for 15 years. She is seeking a loan to buy products to stock her store such as milk, sugar, rice, pasta, etc. She is grateful for the support she is receiving and commits to pay her debt on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply her grocery store

loans.name: Mrs. Eng Ly Nget Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people who live in Ampil Lech village in Takeo province make up a village bank loan group. Mrs. Eng Ly N. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes so that it can improve their businesses in the future. 

Mrs. Eng Ly N. is a weaver and her husband, Mr. Roeurn Yen, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support his family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. Thus to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Eng Ly N. is seeking a loan to buy silk. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is a weaver, while another one is enrolled in local public school, and the youngest one is only three years old.

loans.use: To buy silk

loans.name: Mrs. Kon Long Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Ampil Lech village in Takeo province, sixteen people make up a village bank loan group. Mrs. Kon L. is the village bank president, selected by all the members who will each use their loan for different purposes. She is a weaver working at her home and her husband, Mr. Prorlet C., is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectare of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support his famiL.. Their problem is that her husband’s field has infertile soil, it has a lot of insects, and it is a L. way from the irrigation system. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Kon L. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline. She is the mother of a child who is a weaver, too.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Mrs. Sithim Hai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people make up this village bank loan group and they live in Cheung Loung village in Takeo province. They will use the loan for different purposes so that it can improve their businesses in the future. 

Mrs. Sithim H. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She is a weaver working at her home and her husband, Mr. Soch Nob, is a fisherman and aside from this, he is a farmer who owns a 1.70-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to support his family. Since her weaving business is going well, she wants to expand it. So to improve her business, Mrs. Sithim H. is seeking a loan to buy silk. She is the mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy silk

loans.name: Mrs. Sokha Tai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Cheung Loung village in Takeo province, fourteen people make up this village bank loan group. They will use the loan for different purposes so that it can improve their businesses in the future. 

Mrs. Sokha T. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Sokha T. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Chantha Phorn, is a traditional musician and aside from this, he is a fisherman too. She has four children, one of whom is a laborer, while the others are enrolled in local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Chroeb Pen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people in Thnal Louk village in TaK. province make up a village bank loan group. They will use the loan for different purposes so that it can improve their businesses in the future.

 Mrs. Chroeb P. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She is a coffee seller in the local village and aside from this, she is a pig breeder too. Her husband, Mr. Sambath Orang, is a farmer who owns a more than two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support his family. 

Their problem is that their field has infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Chroeb P. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while another is attending local public school, and the youngest one is only one year old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet P. is from the village of Brgy.Villaros, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 27 years old and single. Juliet owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling mobile phone credit loads in the local community. Juliet has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Juliet joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting her first loan, of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Belita

texts.en:
Belita S. has been dreaming of pulling her family out of poverty. She does not dream of becoming wealthy, though. Her dreams for her family, especially for her only child who is now 16 years old, are very simple. She hopes for: food on the table every meal for them to share and enjoy, a college degree for her daughter, and a house to shelter them from any form of calamity.  

By growing her manicure and pedicure service through the financial assistance of ASHI loans, she hopes to have more profit to support her hopes and dreams for her family. Now, she goes house to house to serve her customers, yet she is given just a small amount of money for a payment. Someday, she hopes to have her own beauty shop with complete facilities for her customers to enjoy and relax in when they come to her shop. She believes that, if she and her husband (who is a hired carpenter) work hard to earn money, it is possible that they will succeed.

loans.use: To purchase materials to provide manicures and pedicures

loans.name: Mr. Chheun Saem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of thirteen people who live in Thnal Louk village in Takeo province. Mr. Chheun S. is the group leader, selected by all the members who will use the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses in the future.

Mr. Chheun S. is a village chief and a farmer who owns 2.5 hectares of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. His problem is that his rice field is ready to be plowed, but he does not have enough money to get it done. To improve rice production, Mr. Chheun S. is requesting a loan to hire laborers to plow his field. His wife, Mrs. Sopha M., is a merchant and he has three children who are studying at school.

loans.use: To hire laborers to plow his rice field

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran is 41 years old, married, and has five children. For the past 10 years, her family has lived in a small house of two rooms.
 
She is an uneducated lady, but she doesn’t want that also to be her chidlren's destiny. By the blessing of God three of her children (two daughters and one son) are enrolled in a school and are reading in 6th, 5th and 4th standards. Her first two sons work in a local factory and earn monthly wages.
 
She is a very hardworking lady. Although she is not educated, she learned sewing skills from her mother. She began to benefit from these skills after her marriage. Now she is an expert at sewing and can sew designer and non-designer clothes easily. She earns approximatley PKR 5000 every month, which she saves for the future of her children. 

Her husband is a fruit vendor and has been in this business for over 10 years. He sells fruit by going to different areas of the community on his four-wheeled cart. He hopes to have his own fruit shop in the main market where people can come to buy fruit. 
 
Sugran has successfully repaid five loans to Asasah (microfinance institution in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva). Now she is applying for a loan for the sixth time to purchase seasonal fruit in bulk so her husband may expand his fruit-selling business and generate a good income.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fruit in bulk to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhom Ai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twenty people who live in Prech village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sokhom A. is the village bank president, selected by all the members who will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Sokhom A. is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to cultivate rice to feed her family; she is also a food seller. Her husband, Mr. Sophark Sok, sells recycled items. Her problem is that her husband’s business does not have a motorbike for transportation. To improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Sokhom A. is seeking a loan to buy a new motorbike. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local public school, while the youngest one is a month old. On the day of the loan disbursement, Mrs. Sokhom A. was busy working in the field. Instead, her husband, Mr. Sophark Sok, received the loan for her.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Teofista

texts.en:
Mrs. Teofista P. is from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 46 years old, married, and has three children. Teofista is a PDP-LP member. She owns a sari-sari store (variety store). Her husband is a farmer and sometimes also a laborer. All her children went to school. Teofista has managed her business for one year and earns approximately 3000 a month.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. This is her first loan from PMPC. She requests a loan of 3000 PHP. This loan will be used to expand her business and to provide additional capital for it. She intends to use the additional revenue generated from the business to help improve her family's standard of living.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her variety store

loans.name: Mrs. Savoeun Oem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen people who live in Prech village in Takeo province. Mrs. Savoeun O. is the village bank president, selected by all the members who will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Savoeun O. is a soft drink and chicken seller in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. To improve her business, Mrs. Savoeun O. is requesting a loan to buy more chickens and soft drinks for resale. Her husband, Mr. Kem Boeurn, is a construction worker and a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice and vegetables to sell to support his family. They have a 2-year-old child.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Mrs. Fe A. from Blancia, St. Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, is 41 years old, married and the mother of one child. A PDP-LP member, Fe has operated a sari-sari store for over a year, earning about 5000 a month, while her husband farms.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to learn how to more effectively engage in business activities. Having fully repaid her previous loan of 7000 from PMPC that was used to expand her business, Fe is now requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 8000 to use as additional capital for her business, and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Welfreda

texts.en:
Mrs. Welfreda C. is from Bogo, Capalaran Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is 52 years old and married with four children. Of her four children, only one went to school. She is a PDP-LP member and her husband is a laborer. Mrs. Welfreda is a vendor at IBJT, Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She has been operating her business for a year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.
   
She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. Now she has a new loan of 5000 PHP taken from PMPC and this loan is intended for additional capital for her business. This was her second cycle of availing of loans from PMPC. 

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital of her business

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Mrs. Ellen S. is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 49 years old and is married with one child. Ellen has managed her sari-sari (variety) store for more than a year, earning approximately PHP 3,000 a month. She and her husband help with each other with their business. Ellen is a PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) member. She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. This is her first loan from PMPC and it will be used as additional capital for her business so as to expand it. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Aside from having a hog-fattening business and a vegetable-farming business in partnership with her husband, Elsie D. C. wants to start up a small sari-sari (variety) store to augment her family’s income and to support their daily basic needs.

Elsie is happy that, despite being poor, she has been able to have the opportunity to receive a loan as a financial source to grow a business. Through her proceeds she hopes to build up savings for the education until college of her two children who are aged 7 and 9 years old.

For her current businesses, Elsie hopes to fatten more pigs and sell more of them either alive or slaughtered to the people in her village or in the market. For her vegetable-farming she wishes to have her own land to cultivate and will not be renting anymore.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her new sari-sari store, other commodities to sell and more piglets to raise

loans.name: Mrs. Sarem Long Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of seventeen people who live in Prech village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sarem L. is the village bank president, selected by all the members who will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Sarem L. is a soft drink seller in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. To improve her business, Mrs. Sarem L. is applying for a loan to buy more soft drinks to resell. Her husband, Mr. Siy S., is a palm fruit collector and a farmer. Mrs. Sarem L. is the mother of six children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Sari Karya Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut N. is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Ni Ketut is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 'Sari Karya'.

Ni Ketut is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, Ni Ketut owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for sale.  Ni Ketut has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2010, Ni Ketut joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Ketut is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  Ni Ketut plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation, and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.







Ni Ketut N. merupakan 45 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Ketut adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 13 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Sari Karya.


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Ketut sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Ketut bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Ketut meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mrs Mila D. is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 58 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter and supports their basic daily needs. To make a living, Mila manages a videoke and refreshment business. She has managed her business for more than a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month. Mila is a PDP-LP member.
Mila joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC, which will be used as additional capital for business expansion. This will be her first loan from PMPC. With the additional revenue generated from her business, Mila hopes to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Mr. Sambath Ban Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has eleven people who live in Chheu Teal village in Kandal province. Mr. Sambath B. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. Each member will use their loan for a different purpose that will improve their businesses in the future.

Mr. Sambath B. is a fisherman and his wife, Mrs. Chea Net Keo, is a fish and fruit seller in the local market. Since his wife’s business is going well, Mr. Sambath B. wants to expand it to improve his family’s living conditions. He is seeking a loan to buy more fruits and fish for his wife to resell. 

The couple supports seven children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while another three are studying in the local public school, and the youngest one is two years old.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and fish for his wife to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca R. is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old, married, and has two children – one is a college student and the other is a high school student. Her husband is a soldier and supports their basic daily needs. Francisca runs a business buying and selling all types of products. She also has another business selling beauty products. She earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month.
Francisca has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP from Kiva partner, PMPC, which will be used as additional capital for her buy-and-sell business. This will be her first loan from PMPC. Francisca is a Paglaum Development Program for Landless People (PDP-LP) member.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her buy-and-sell business

loans.name: Mrs. Surn Oum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 17 people who live I. Kab Leav village I. Kandal province. They will all use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Surn O. is the village bank president selected by all the members.
Mrs. Surn O. is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She also makes thatch to sell, too. Her obstacle is that her field has infertile soil. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Surn O. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, and will use the rest of the loan to plow her rice field. She is a widow with three children, all of whom are enrolled I. a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Our featured entrepreneur, Mrs. Arlyn T., is a single-seat motorcab operator and an owner of a sari-sari store. She is 29 years old, married to Mr. Yoshihiro T. of Japan (a government employee), and blessed with one infant-aged child. She is a resident of P1 Garang, Tangub City. Even though she received a monthly allowance from her husband, Arlyn still had a passion for business. At present, she has a sari-sari store with an average net income of 1,500 PHP per month, and has two single-seat motorcabs for hire that bring in an average income of 240 PHP daily. These earnings are so helpful in supporting her family. Arlyn joined Kiva partner, PMPC, in 2009. She was given the privilege of borrowing 25,000 PHP as her first loan, which was used to purchase a single motorcab for hire. This time, she is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to add to her capital for her sari-sari store. The future income from this loan will be used to make her loan repayments and also as savings for future use. She is hoping that someday her business will become more progressive.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her sari-sari store business

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
Sự Trương Thị (20203050050) is a 44-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Sự is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 2 - Nhóm 09 (9).
Sự is married and has three adult-aged children. To making a living, she owns and operates a butcher shop. The main source of income for the business comes from butchering and selling pork in the local community. Sự has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.
In 2009, Sự joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her second from SEDA. Sự plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the other borrowers in the group
1. Nguyễn Thị B. (0) is a 21-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.
2. Trương Thị H. (0) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
3. Trương Thị H. (0) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.
4. Trương Thị H. (0) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About SEDA
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Sự Trương Thị (20203050050) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Sự là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 2 - Nhóm 09 (9). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa pH.. Sự thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Sự kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND. Vào 2009, Sự đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Sự đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị B. (0) là 21 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. 2. Trương Thị H. (0) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Trương Thị H. (0) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 4. Trương Thị H. (0) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo B. biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay B. Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mrs. Ol Seoun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of nine people in Prey Totueng village in Kandal province. Mrs. Ol S. is the village bank president selected by all the members. They will all use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Ol S. is a fish and pork seller in a local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. In order to improve her business, she is requesting a loan to buy more fish and pork for resale. Mrs. Ol S. is a widow with a child who works as a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more fish and pork for resale

loans.name: Sophall's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of five people who live in Ta Loek village in Kandal province. Each member is going to use their loan for a different purpose that improves their business in the future. Mrs. Sophall D. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members.
Mrs. Sophall D. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. In addition to this, she sell cakes. Her problem is that her rice field has infertile soil. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Sophall D. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. She is a widow with three children, two of whom attend a local public school, while the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Adita

texts.en:
Adita G. enjoys the beauty of nature from her house, situated 300 meters away from the fine sand of the wide seashore and the crystal-blue water of the ocean. Her family also enjoys life in its simplest form. 

From the time she married, Adita's family has made use of the abundant resources of their surroundings by using fishing, managed by Adita's husband, as their main source of income. Their livelihood from fishing is how Adita has been able to see her eldest child graduate from college and the needs of her four other children, aged 13 to 26, supported.

In 2008, Adita and her husband decided to expand their fishing activities into a business. Adita joined Kiva's partner, ASHI, to gain access to financial support for their aspirations. Over time, their fishing business has been improving. They were able to purchase a fishing boat, which now has to be repaired after several years of use. 

For this, Adita is requesting a much larger loan amount. She hopes that by reconditioning the engine and the boat itself, her husband will be able to catch more fish for her to sell directly to people in their village. She also wishes to put aside some savings for renovating their house and hopes to support her eldest child, who works for ASHI as a Development Officer. 

Adita’s eldest child is her inspiration to work hard and support her youngest child's education, as her three other children have not finished their college education due to lack of financial support.

loans.use: To purchase materials to repair her husband's fishing boat

loans.name: Sodikchon

texts.ru: Эргашев Содикчон проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 45 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Имеет средне - специальное образование. По профессии шафер. В этой области проработал три года. Сейчас Содикчон занимается торговлей. У него магазин, где он продает бытовую технику. Этим бизнесом занимается более 16 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Sodikchon E. lives in the region of Vahdat. He is 45 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker. Sodikchon has a specialized secondary education. He is a driver by profession and has worked in this field for three years. At this time Sodichkon is in retail. He has a store where he sells household appliances. He has been in this business for more than sixteen years. He is asking for a loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Samkol's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of four people who live in Lekh Pram village in Kandal province. Mrs. Nha S. is the group leader, selected by all the members who are each going to use their loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Nha S. is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family, and her husband, Mr. Sophea Nara Ten, is a motorbike taxi driver. Now she has a big problem because her house is too old to live in. So to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Nha S. is applying for a loan to fix her house. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in local public school, while the youngest one is only two years old.

loans.use: To fix her house

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong T. N. was born in 1982. She lives with her husband and three children (two girls and a son who are still young). She breeds pigs and chickens. Her husband is a worker for a small mechanic workshop. They have a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to buy 10 more pigs and food for her chickens. Hopefully, this plan will turn a profit so that her family may afford to buy more household appliances.

loans.use: to buy more 10 pigs and food for chicken

loans.name: Mrs. Soeurn Choeurn Village Bank Group

texts.en: Ten people who live in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan group. Mrs. Soeurn C. is the village bank president, selected by all the members who are each going to use their loan for different purposes. She is a Khmer noodle seller in her local village and aside from this she is a white wine maker. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So to improve this business, Mrs. Soeurn C. is requesting a loan to buy more rice to make white wine. She is a widow with a child who is forty years old.

loans.use: To buy more rice to make white wine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a camera

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita H. is an example of a strong woman who can thrive and make a living to help support her family. A 47-year-old mother of five children, she lives in the town of Tanay, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. Marita’s main goal is to build a sustainable business to meet the needs of her children; she was thus encouraged to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 1999. The previous loans she received from Kiva were carefully invested in her sari-sari (variety) store. Since then, the store has been performing well and earning her sufficient profit. She is grateful that she has been able to educate her children using proceeds from her business as she continues to expand. 

Marita needs a loan to help boost her business for increased profit making. Now requesting her sixth loan, she is requesting for 25,000 PHP as additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store, to be used to pay for groceries for her venture. Marita is optimistic that she can achieve her dreams of providing a good life for her children and of being able to send them to school until they finish college. She also hopes to expand her business and, if possible, she would like to have a branch in the town proper, in order to provide employment to others. She hopes that these dreams will come true and that ASHI will in fact give the best direction and opportunity for her family.

loans.use: To pay for groceries for her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Mrs. Phara Ly Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Anlong Ta Sek Leu village in Kandal province, seven people make up a village bank loan group. Mrs. Phara L. is the village bank president, selected by all the members who will each use their loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Thorn Orauk, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow rice and vegetables on to sell to support their famiL.. Their problem is that their farm is a long way from the irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Phara L. is requesting a loan to buy hose. Through this activity, they support three children, two of whom are attending in local public school, while the other is too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy hose

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl L. is from Tanay, Rizal. She is 29 years old. She is married and has 3 minor-aged children. To make a living, Cheryl owns & operates a vegetable-vending business & tends to buy and sell frozen foods in her village and nearby town. Cheryl has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a week for these activities. In 2005, Cheryl aimed to join ASHI to secure access to financial services to help improve her living condition and to have the ability to engage in more business activities. Cheryl has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASHI. This previous loan was used to purchase inventory for her business. Cheryl is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory of vegetables & frozen foods products. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Cheryl from ASHI. She plans to use the additional proceeds generated from the business to develop her business. She hopes that, with the help of KIVA field partner, she can reach her ambition to step out from under umbrella of poverty, develop her business, and provide for the needs of her children in school.

Her long term goals are to purchase a new jeepney and tricycle so that she can expand her vegetables & frozen foods vending business to other surrounding neighborhoods. By owning her own transportation, Cheryl will save time and money in purchasing a greater variety of inventory as well as selling products in additional territories. She also dreams to have her own stall in the public market where she can sell her products. With her hard work, focus, and determination, Cheryl is hopeful that her business ventures will continue to grow and improve the overall standard of living for her entire family.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of vegetables & frozen foods products.

loans.name: Srey Voch's Group

texts.en: Four people make up a village bank loan and they live in Mitakpheap village in Kandal province. Mrs. Srey Voch K. is the group leader, selected by all the members who will each use their loan to improve their businesses in the future. She is a seamstress in a garment factory and her husband, Mr. Savat Thorn, is a policeman. She has a problem because her work place is a long way from her home. So to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Srey Voch K. is applying for a loan to buy a new motorbike as transportation. She is a mother of three children who are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
T. T. N. is 33 years old. She lives in Tien KH. village with her parents in-law, her husband and their three children. Her childen are young. She is a framer. Every day, she goes T. next village T. buy scrap-iron T. resell. Her husband is a builder. He has a daily income of about 70,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). Her family has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. They always try T. earn money T. raise the children. So, they are working hard. Mrs T. has participated in SEDA since 2006 and repaid punctually. She is a cluster leader and is the group leader of an 8-member loan group. In this loan cycle, she wants T. borrow 7,194,000 VND for her small business with hopefully T. have better life.

 About the other borrowers in her group:
 Tam T. D. is 54 years old. She grows vegetables and raises chickens. She wants T. borrow 654,000 VND T. buy fertilizer.
 Tinh T. T. ís 35 years old. She wants T. borrow 6,758,000 VND T. breed pigs.
 T. T. T. N. is 28 years old. She grows vegetables. She wants T. borrow 6,758,000 VND T. buy fertilizer.
 Uyen T. N. is 36 years old, she wants T. borrow 6,758,000 VND T. grow vegetables.
 Mien T. H. is 51 years old, she wants T. borrow 6,758,000 VND T. breed pigs.
 My T. N. is 42 years old, she wants T. borrow 6,758,000 VND T. invest in her business.
 Do T. N. is 58 years old, she wants T. borrow 6,758,000 VND for her small business.

loans.use: to invest in her small business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokun S. is the group leader of four people who live in Krang Koam village in Kandal province. Those members will each use their loan for a different purpose so as to improve their business in the future.

Mrs. Sokun S. is a snack and wine seller at her home and her husband, Mr. Kim Srey, charges batteries in their village.

Mrs. Sokun S.’s problem is that her husband’s generator motor is too old to use. So, to improve this condition, she is requesting a loan to buy a new motor instead of the old one.

Mrs. Sokun S. is the mother of five children, three of whom are attending the local public school, while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a new motor for her husband's battery-charging business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials for shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Mr. Borin Chheang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people who live in Spean Daek village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan group. Mr. Borin C. is the village bank president, selected by all the members, who will each use their loan for different purposes so that it can improve their businesses in the future. He is a motorbike taxi driver and his wife, Mrs. Solim Soth, is a Khmer cake maker in their local village. 

Since his wife’s business is going well he wants to expand it. So to improve this business, Mr. Borin C. is seeking a loan to buy more firewood for making cakes in the raining season. He is the father of five children who are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for making cake

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Merlyn G. is from Linconan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Merlyn is 32 years old. Mrs. G. is engaged in different business activities. Her husband is a farmer, which serves as their main source of income. She earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to be engaged in other business activities. She successfully repaid their previous loan taken from PMPC. This previous loan was for the expansion of their business. As of now, Merlyn has a new loan of 10,000 taken from PMPC. This loan is for  additional capital for their business and also to expand their farming. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Towards additional capital for her farm and fish vending businesses.

loans.name: Letecia Cartajenas' Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Letecia C., 55 years of age and married, is a resident of Stimson Abordo, Ozamiz City. Letecia is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Letecia C.’ Group. 	

Letecia is married to Eleuterio, the driver of their own passenger truck for hire. They are blessed with 5 children, all now at adult age. The couple decided to engage in business, particularly in the chain saw and passenger truck for hire operating business. For 5 years already, the couple has been able to manage this business and this time they are earning an average income. She joined the cooperative in 2009. As an active member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program that reached out the rural poor, she is requesting an amount of PHP10,000.00 as her 2nd cycle loan. This loan will be used towards house renovation, including building of toilet and bathroom. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, to meet their basic needs and savings for future use and for future business expansion. She is hoping that someday their business will become more progressive.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house renovation, toilet and bathroom building

location.town: Stimson Abordo, Ozamiz City Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Ardeliza Batocael Group

texts.en:
Ardeliza A B. is from the village of Lower Puntod. She is 63 years old. Ardeliza is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ardeliza is married and has 1 adult child. Ardeliza owns & operates a business harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Ardeliza has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ardeliza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Ardeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Ardeliza is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ardeliza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is a wife of M. A. and belongs to a city named Borewala (city famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for the past 8 years. Safia is an uneducated lady but she doesn’t want to befall the same destiny for her children. 

She has six children: five sons and one daughter. Her first three sons completed their education up to the 8th standard and couldn’t get study further because the state of their house was getting worse, day by day, and they needed to generate income. They decided to quit their studies. Her elder two work in a local factory on monthly wages. The next son is a daily wage laborer in the wooden market. Now, with the income, they are helping their younger siblings to achieve their education. Their two younger brothers read in 2nd standard and their sister reads in 3rd standard.

Safia is also a very hardworking lady. She prepares embroidered dresses by receiving the orders from her neighbors and thereby earns income. She saves her income for her children's good futures. She has a wish that her financial condition will improve so that her elder sons also can continue their education. Her husband is a fruit vendor. He sells fruit by going to different areas of the community on his four-wheeled cart. He has been doing this work for over 10 years. 

Safia has successfully repaid her three previous loans to Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) and is now applying for a loan for the fourth time to purchase seasonal fruits, in bulk, so that her husband may expand his business and increase the profit.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fruits in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Anelyn Kilat Group

texts.en:
Anelyn K. is from the village of Balanlinao. She is 37 years old. Anelyn is the group leader of a three member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Anelyn is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Anelyn owns a business in which she raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Anelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Anelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Anelyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Anelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria P., 52, is making sure that her family has enough provisions to meet their daily needs. Married to Mariano P., they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn a living so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store while doing direct selling of popular brands of clothing and cosmetics.

Victoria has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a loan of 25,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying advance orders of clothing and cosmetics in her direct selling line.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide a comfortable and well off future for her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy advance orders of clothing and cosmetics for her direct selling line

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 25-year-old married woman with one son. She lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over three years. 

She is a seamstress and her clientele base is her neighbors.  Although she works seven hours a day, she manages her house very efficiently. She takes care of her son and her husband as well. 

Her husband's name is I. A.. He operates an electric shop where he sells electric supplies such as wires, switch boards, and tube lights in the market. His earnings allow him to manage the financial expenses. 

Zubiada is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah to purchase electric supplies in bulk to increase the profit of her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase electric supplies for her husband to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario V., 49, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She has been in the printing business for quite some time now. A regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now, Rosario regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative, using the money to expand and improve her printing business.

To ensure the continued success of her business, Rosario is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be used as additional capital to buy materials needed to maintain operations of her printing business. She dreams that her business will continue to prosper so that she can keep expanding while at the same time ensuring that she continues to provide quality service to her customers.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy materials needed to continue operations of her printing business

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita M. is a 63-year-old, hardworking wife and mother. She is not just a plain housewife, but is also a very supportive business partner to her husband, a farmer. Along with their three children, they combat poverty with not much material or financial wealth in their possession aside from a dream nursed in their hearts that fuels their physical and mental capabilities to get out from under the weight of poverty.  

Through the proceeds of a buying and selling “bangus” (milk fish, the national fish) fry (fingerlings) and farming rice, Estelita has able to graduate one of her children from college. Though two of her children did not earn college degrees, Estelita and her husband are still happy since they are enjoying the careers they chose -- one as a hired laborer and the other abroad as a domestic helper. 

Looking back to the kind of life Estelita and her family have had in the past, she could recognize a lot of improvements had happened. Partially, their house has improved and Estelita wants to fully accomplish it through the proceeds of her business. For that, she is requesting a much larger amount of loan to finance the rice-farming business managed by her husband.

loans.use: To purchase necessary farm inputs such as seedlings, fertlizers and to pay for laborers and the rental of farm equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her cinnamon garden

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia T. is from the village of San Jose. She is 41 years old. Lydia is married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Lydia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 75,000 PHP during harvest season.

In 2005, Lydia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Lydia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is a 38-year-old woman who lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms in which she has been living with her family for the past 15 years.
   
She is a mother of six children: three sons and three daughters. Her elder daughter reads in 12th standard, the next reads in 6th standard and the youngest one reads in 2nd standard. Her elder son reads in 4th standard and the next two read in kindergarten. Zahida dreams of seeing her children with good educations and settled in good positions. 

To achieve her dream, she performs her duty of a seamstress. Her duty pays her a reward in a shape of money, which she saves for the future of her kids. She has been doing this work for over three years. Her clientele base includes her neighbors.
 
Her husband's name is A. S. and he runs a tea stall in the food market. His tea stall is famous with customers. His presentation attracts more customers to his tea stall. He offers a variety of tea, such as milky, creamy and green. His stall is going well because the people of Pakistan are fond of tea in every season, whether it is summer or winter. He has eight years of experience running the tea stall.
 
Zahida has successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) and now she is applying for a loan for the second time to purchase items (milk, tea and sugar) to expand her husband’s tea-stall business.

loans.use: Purcahse items for tea stand

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria D. is happy with the fact that, despite being poor, she has been able to keep her family together and loving each other. Her husband is as hardworking as she is and has been cooperating well to achieve her dream of improving their standard of living. Both of them are hands-on with her hog-fattening business, which was started in 2007, when she became a member of ASHI and received a loan through the institution. 

When Victoria seems to be very busy in attending to their three children, who range in age from 7 to 11 years, her husband is the one who takes care of the pigs. After four months of fattening, the pigs will be sold to people in their village or in the market, either slaughtered or alive. The profit they gain is used to provide their children with better food and clothes and to support their education expenses.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her pig pen and to purchase piglets for fattening

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina R. is from the village of San Jose. She is 42 years old. Gina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 150,000 PHP a month every harvest season.

In 2005, Gina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Gina is requesting a new loan of 32,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Gina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Mrs. Evangeline N., a 55-year-old farmer who earns about 3000 per month, is from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, where she is the married mother of four children, three of whom attend school. Her husband is also a farmer who supports their daily basic needs. Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to better engage in business activities.
